node.text: Yet another dimwit looking for shiny baubles? Go on then, what do you want?

option.optiontext: What do you make of this Strange Gem?
I changed my mind about the gem I sold you, I want it back.
Just want to see what you have for sale.
In a manner of speaking, I'm in need of a focusing crystal.
Hello, who are you?

node.text: Eh? If you want to make friends, talk to that silly girl Birna up in the tower, but don't drag me into it. Now buy something or leave!

option.optiontext: What do you make of this Strange Gem?
Okay, let me see your stock.
Fine, whatever.

node.text: Eh? Where did you get that? Doesn't matter, I'll give you 500 coins for it.

option.optiontext: But what is it?
Fine, I'll sell it for 500.
You seem eager to buy it.

node.text: If you don't already know, then it doesn't matter. Take it or leave it, 500 coins.

option.optiontext: Fine, I'll sell it for 500.
You seem eager to buy it.

node.text: Humph... 1000 coins, final offer.

option.optiontext: No deal.

node.text: Fine, that's fine.
Then get out!
You made the right choice.
Eh? What would you need something like that for? You don't look like you could focus enough magic to lift a feather. But no, don't answer, I don't really care.
I don't sell focusing crystals, I buy them from time to time from that girl at the general store - Mary or something. Go bother her.

option.optiontext: Where can I find her shop?
Okay, let me see what you have for sale.
Alright, thanks.

node.text: At the marketplace. Now buy something, or leave.

option.optiontext: Thanks, let's see what you have for sale.
Alright, thanks.

node.text: Well... isn't that a shame. But of course you can have it back! For a mere 2000 gold coins, of course...

option.optiontext: What?! That's nowhere near what you paid me for it!
Fine... <color=orange> (2000 coins) </color>

node.text: Isn't it? Oh dear, I just can't seem to recall. The price is 2000 coins, take it or leave it.

option.optiontext: Fine... <color=orange> (2000 coins) </color>

node.text: Hehehe... alright then, you can have the gem back.

option.optiontext: get me our of here plz

node.text: Greetings, sir! Would you like to access your bank account today?

option.optiontext: Yes please.
I'm here to pick up a package for Shopkeeper Rainer.

node.text: Ah, yes! The package for Rainer. Here you go. Please deliver it to him safely.

option.optiontext: Got it. I'll deliver it to him.

node.text: I can store your goods, mate - safely. The only one around here who can. Or maybe you'd like to buy one of my strongboxes, eh?

option.optiontext: I need you take some items off me.
Strongboxes you say?
But are you trustworthy?

node.text: Hah, of course not! Ain't gonna find trustworthy people here in Bootlegger's Shelter. But I ain't gonna lose your goods if that's what you're worried about. Wouldn't stay in business long if I did.

option.optiontext: I need you take some items off me.
You mentioned strongboxes?

node.text: Yeh, big city banks don't like it but I can craft chests strong enough ain't no one gonna break into them without ruining what's inside. Course, it all comes with a hefty fee.

option.optiontext: Let me see.
I need you take some items off me.
Maybe another time.

node.text: Come to peruse my wares? All prices are fair and non-negotiable. And don't try any tricks, got two strong lads waiting outside just for that. Too many tricksters around here.

option.optiontext: Let's see what you have.
How does anyone set up a jewelry shop in the poorest district of the city?
Know anything about a secret passage into Thornhill Dungeons?
Tell me again about the secret passage into Thornhill Dungeons.

node.text: My goods are all legally acquired as far as anyone's concerned. And anyone who'd like to claim otherwise, well... I've made sure the guards see things my way, so good luck with that. Now, I hope you didn't come here just to chatter?

option.optiontext: Let's see what you have.
Know anything about a secret passage into Thornhill Dungeons?
Tell me again about the secret passage into Thornhill Dungeons.
Can't shop here in good conscience...

node.text: If you're gonna complain about the Lord Mayor, I'll have to drag you to the dungeons. Far too many smartmouths these days... people gotta learn to be content with their lot.

option.optiontext: I'm looking for a healer named Arren.
Know anything about a secret passage into the prison?
Is the weather always so terrible around here?
The city, it seems a bit... ravaged?

node.text: Yeah I've heard of that twirp, has a shack in Mudderside. Northeastern district of the city, next to the docks.

option.optiontext: Is the weather always so terrible around here?
Does the city seem a bit... gloomy?
Thank you.

node.text: Think yourself funny, do you? You better scurry off and fast before I give you a beating.
Hah! Usually it's worse. Down in Haywind they get pampered by those Hydrobor magi, who clear the clouds for them. No such luck here, traveler.

option.optiontext: I'm looking for a healer named Arren.
Know anything about a secret passage into the prison?
Does the city seem a bit... gloomy?

node.text: Didn't hear of the Blistering Plight? A nasty disease that's only now begun to release its grip on our city. You'd think getting rid of sickness would be cause for celebration, but nah... folk on the streets are angrier than usual.

option.optiontext: Do they have reason to be?
Bleak weather, is this normal?
I'm looking for a healer named Arren.
Know anything about a secret passage into the prison?

node.text: I guess they're a bit mad about our good Lord Mayor locking himself in, ''abandoning the city to its fate'' or some such nonsense. I mean, what was he supposed to do anyway?

option.optiontext: Bleak weather, is this normal?
I'm looking for a healer named Arren.
Know anything about a secret passage into the prison?

node.text: <color=#9C8C77> *The captain measures you suspiciously with his eyes.* </color>
Yeah, what do you want?

option.optiontext: Know anything about a secret passage into Thornhill dungeons?
Tell me again about the secret passage into Thornhill dungeons.
Nothing, nevermind.

node.text: Know what I like about Thornhill? Don't have to deal with countryside hicks around here.

option.optiontext: What's for sale?

node.text: Daggers and swords, axes and maces... so many different ways to kill, it fascinates me.

option.optiontext: Exactly what I'm looking for.
Killing fascinates you...?
Fascinating, but I shall go.

node.text: It does, aye. Ever since I got abducted by a troll one time. The thing wanted me to be its 'servant' out in the woods, stirring its cookpot for it. That cookpot... it liked bringing people to its camp, chop them up, throw them in...
One time it had brought to camp a poor soldier. As it was preparing him, I picked that man's axe from the ground and split the troll's head with it. I'll say, never felt so powerful in my life.

option.optiontext: Grim stuff, let me see your weapons.
I should go.

node.text: Aye, 'ello. Are you by chance in need of any armor platin' good sir?

option.optiontext: I am indeed.
What's it like being an armorer around here?
Not today.

node.text: Oh I dunno, I just try to mind my own business. People here are way too intense. Like that lady selling weapons next door, she scares me sometimes. People scare me, so I make armor.

option.optiontext: Makes sense, let's see what you have.
Good luck.

node.text: Folk call me the Silverhair. If you want, I'll make for you the best bow anyone can in these lands.

option.optiontext: I'd like to see that.
Isn't that what every bow merchant would say?

node.text: Heh, maybe... I can back my words up though. Or you can try every other bow merchant and then come back to me.

option.optiontext: I'll take a look then.
I'll try every other bow merchant first.

node.text: Master Wizard Tyrhen at the Academy of Masters taught me all I know. He's since retired and his protege Isabella Grey's taken over, she and I studied at the same time... point being, the Hydrobor Magi aren't the only ones who hold knowledge of the arcane arts in these lands, even if they pretend to be.

option.optiontext: I heard a rumor you might have magical bombs in store...
What was it you wanted in exchange for the magic bomb again?
I have the divination bones you asked for.
Happen to have any more of those bombs...?
option.actions: AddItems=1807-1-true,NpcChat=Please try to handle them with care!

option.optiontext: Interesting shop, what's for sale?

node.text: yea but i need ting from shaman first
ting from shaman in troll vcillage oke
ty, here u go
My father was a soldier, and his father before him. I hate war and want nothing to do with it. So no, you won't find plate armor in my shop, but I do sell master crafted clothes and embroidery.

option.optiontext: I'll have a look at your wares.
How about a master crafted plague doctor's outfit?
Do you know where to find medicinal herbs for the plague doctor's outfit??

node.text: Greetings, fella! This may be a rough neighborhood, but I keep a tidy inn, so don't be causing any trouble here. I can call on some burly friends if you do, just so you know... Now, what can I get ya?

option.optiontext: A beer will do, thanks...
What about that other guy, is he giving you trouble?
This is a rough neighborhood?
I'm looking for a way into Thornhill Dungeons.

node.text: Willy-boy? Nah... He's all bark and no bite. Besides, he knows I know fellas who can give him more trouble than it's worth causing here, if you catch my drift. A girl needs fellas like that if she's to run an inn around these parts - just the way it is.

option.optiontext: I'll have a beer, thanks...
This is a rough neighborhood?
I see.

node.text: The harbor always attracts scoundrels and smugglers and the sort, you know? Things seem to be getting worse, though. The disease that swept our city - the Blistering Plight - well, it didn't help things any.

Between the two of us, the city's boiling beneath the surface. The Lord-Mayor's always been a harsh master, but times have gotten harder and a lot of his men only more cruel. I fear one of these days the city's just gonna burst, you know?

option.optiontext: So what can a man do but have a drink...
What's with that sailor yelling at you, he giving you trouble?
I see, thanks for the news.

node.text: Greetings, brother. I'm teaching your son about being a man.

option.optiontext: Is that so?
I'll leave you to it.

node.text: Father! Uncle Bodevar is teaching me how to use the sword!
That's right, brother. After all, somebody here should make sure the boy doesn't grow into a spineless milksop. Don't you remember how hard father pushed us when we were his age?

option.optiontext: It's true, the boy needs more discipline. How's his form looking?
I do. Frankly I was hoping not to repeat his mistakes.
I see. I'll leave you to it.

node.text: I'm getting quite good at this, father. Look! *Gadwin swings his practice sword.*

option.optiontext: Indeed. But listen, boy; you need get yourself ready for tonight's banquet.
Indeed. Carry on.

node.text: But father, I haven't finished my training! Tell him, uncle!
Humm... Yes... There are a few skills we still meant to cover. Seems to me you could use a bit of practice too, Rothar. After all, when was the last time you handled a sword?

option.optiontext: It has been awhile...
I'll have you know my sword handling skills are perfectly fine.

node.text: Then it's settled! Pick up a training sword from the table and strike that dummy over there. Show the boy how it's done, brother.
Pff, nonsense. Father was a hard man but look how we turned out! I'd say it was only necessary.

option.optiontext: That's a discussion for another time. The boy needs to get ready for tonight's banquet.
Well... don't let me stop you. I'll check back later.

node.text: Hah! All the more reason then. You can show the boy how it's really done. Go on, brother, pick up a training sword from the table and strike that dummy over there.

option.optiontext: Oh fine.

node.text: Hahaa, what a swing and bash! What say you, boy?
I don't know... That didn't look terribly convincing, father...
node.contextBefore: Happens BEFORE this node: after whacking the dummy

option.optiontext: You really do need harder discipline, boy.
Really? Have I lost my grip, brother?

node.text: Erm, well... It was a valiant effort, brother, a valiant effort indeed. Isn't that right boy?
Yes uncle...

Your father is a little rusty, that's all. If he kept his skills sharp, he could strike down the fiercest of foes. But sometimes getting up close and personal isn't the best way to go. How fares your aim, brother?

option.optiontext: I'm not sure. Perhaps it could be improved.
I always was more confident with a bow.

node.text: Oh sorry, I meant that was stunning, father! You really struck that dummy hard!
Yes! Uncle said becoming a master archer is a life-long path of learning! Try hitting the target with a bow, father!

option.optiontext: Very well.

node.text: So you say. But as father often liked to remind us, words are best proven by actions. Why don't you try shooting the target with a bow, Rothar?

option.optiontext: Very well.

node.text: Father, you hit the target bullseye! And I was worried you'd miss...
node.contextBefore: Happens BEFORE this node: after shooting the bow

option.optiontext: I'll have you know I won Imberthale's archery championship as a young lad.
Heh. Must've got lucky.

node.text: Modest, eh? Well, you did win that archery contest all the way back, maybe it wasn't for nothing.

option.optiontext: Maybe. Though it was a long time ago.

node.text: Indeed, well... The practice dummy is one thing but how about an opponent that strikes back? Duel me brother, for old times sake?

option.optiontext: Sure, let's do this
Do I have to?

node.text: Come on, Rothar, don't be such a bad sport.

option.optiontext: All right, all right.

node.text: Hah. That is a story you never allow me to forget.

option.optiontext: Oh I would, if you stopped being so sore about it.
Ah well, it's true it was a long time ago.

node.text: Is that so? Well I must say, playing around with the practice dummy is well suited for children, but how about an opponent that strikes back? Duel me brother!

option.optiontext: Let's do this.
Don't be ridiculous.

node.text: Oooooooh please do, father! I want to see this!
What is it, brother? Could it be that you're afraid you might lose? Surely that can't be it.

option.optiontext: You really are begging me to kick your rear.

node.text: Oooooooh this ought to be good!
Oooooooh this ought to be good!
Woah, father! You beat uncle Bodevar!
Yeah, all right... I went easy on you brother. Let's do this again and I'll give you more of a challenge!

option.optiontext: Yes, but Gadwin, we have a banquet to prepare for. Off you go now.

node.text: Aww, but father... When am I getting that sword you promised me? Even uncle said I should practice handling a real sword.

option.optiontext: Can't you have it later?

node.text: But that's what you said last time father...
The boy does need a proper sword, Rothar...

option.optiontext: Oh fine, let me find the smith.

node.text: I saw him pounding away at the forge earlier, down the path east by the quarry. Perhaps he's had a spare one made?

option.optiontext: Let's see. I'll bring your sword, boy.

node.text: Yay! Thanks father, you're the best!
node.contextAfter: Happens AFTER this node: Gadwin quest is updated to bring him a quality sword and a quality bow

node.text: Find Warwick's forge down the path east from here.
node.contextBefore: Happens BEFORE this node: while getting the bow and sword

node.text: Father! Do you have my sword?
node.contextBefore: Happens BEFORE this node: when returning with the sword

option.optiontext: I have it right here, boy. The smith was busy so I hammered it myself.
Hold on, I'll be back with it later.

node.text: Truly? My brother, you are full of surprises!

option.optiontext: Oh yes.

node.text: It's perfect!

option.optiontext: Now, what do you say son? Will you be on your best behavior tonight?

node.text: Yes, father. I will, father.
node.contextAfter: Happens AFTER this node: Gadwin quest is completed

node.text: Heh, Gadwin's a good kid, just needs more discipline. Anyway, how about a rematch on that duel? You know how I hate losing.

option.optiontext: Shouldn't you get yourself ready for the banquet too?
Hell yes, brother.
Maybe later, Bode.

node.text: It's settled then! Pick up a training sword from the table and strike that dummy over there.
node.contextAfter: Happens AFTER this node: Gadwin quest is updated to sufficiently whack the dummy with a sword

option.optiontext: Right, let's see...

node.text: How about you pick up a bow and demonstrate what a true marksman you are, brother.
node.contextAfter: Happens AFTER this node: Gadwin quest is updated to shoot the target with a bow

option.optiontext: Very well.

node.text: Indeed. Well I must say, you've fared well against the dummy and the target, but how about an opponent that strikes back? Duel me brother, and demonstrate to the boy how to use the shield to take a little less of a beating!
node.contextAfter: Happens AFTER this node: Gadwin quest updated to give Bodevar a beating

option.optiontext: Let's do this.

node.text: You know me, I'm not much into dressing up. But don't worry, I promise to brush my hair back and find something half decent to wear.

option.optiontext: As long as you don't show up in full plate mail again...
All right. In that case, let's duel!
Okay then, but I need to run. See you later.

node.text: Hahaha, it was one time! And I did it as a prank, I promise.

option.optiontext: Whatever you say. Anyway, I'm itching for another sparring match!
Okay then, but I need to run. See you later.

node.text: Right on, brother! Don't count on me holding back this time!
Hah! Got you well and good there. Another round?

option.optiontext: Shouldn't you get yourself ready for the banquet too?
Hell yes, brother!
Maybe later, Bode.

node.text: Oof, I know when I'm bested brother. Well fought.

option.optiontext: Another round?
Shouldn't you get yourself ready for the banquet as well?
It's been fun, but I need to go. See you later, Bode.

node.text: You knocked the breath out of me pretty hard there, enough sparring for today I'd say.

option.optiontext: Fair enough. About time you get yourself ready for the banquet too?
It's been fun, but I need to go. See you later, Bode.

node.text: Yes, yes, don't worry. I promise to brush my hair back and find something half decent to wear. Let me just catch my breath for a bit.

option.optiontext: As long as you don't end showing up in full plate mail again...
All right then. Another round?
It's been fun, but I need to go. See you later, Bode.

node.text: Hahaha, it was one time! And I did it as a prank, I promise.

option.optiontext: Whatever you say. Another round?
It's been fun, but I need to go. See you later, Bode.

node.text: 'ello there mastarr!

option.optiontext: Greetings, master smith. Could you craft a sword for me?
I was wondering, could you teach me about smithing?
Carry on, Warwick.

node.text: Aye, I make good swords. Could get ye one by the end of the week.

option.optiontext: I couldn't get one right now?
All right then. I'll leave you to it.

node.text: Now, serrr?! Erm, I'm a bit busy what with these horseshoes. But if yer badly itching fer a new sword then s'ppose ye could try working the forge yerself.

option.optiontext: I see. What can you teach me about working the forge?
Oh. Nevermind then.

node.text: Aye, it's a fairly simple concept, ser. Ye turn ore into bars at the forge, then ye pound them into shape at the anvil. But it requires practise and expertise to get right.

option.optiontext: Where should I get my ore from?
So I take the bars to the anvil and work them into whatever I want?
All right, thanks.

node.text: Why, ye take a pickaxe to the rocks ser! Ye can usually see the type of ore within, like we have a bunch of copparrr nested in these cliffs around us. Copparrr is most commonplace but other types of ore may be harder to come by.

option.optiontext: And after smelting them into bars, I work them into whatever I want at the anvil?
All right, thanks.

node.text: Yea but serrr, ye must remember that it takes skill to shape it right! Maybe a beginner can craft a simple swerrrd, but try to make a currrvy arrrmorrr and yer in trouble. Also, shaping coppar is simple enough but other metals require more practice.

option.optiontext: Okay. And how do I go about getting some ore?
All right, thanks.

node.text: Greetings, sir. Just tending to the grounds, as I do.

option.optiontext: How is it going, Darron?
Carry on, Darron.

node.text: Is all well and good sir. Only the plants are taking over. Everything grows so quickly around here, sir.

option.optiontext: What can be done?
Oh well, good luck with it.

node.text: Let me think... A lot of the spruce could be felled; it's found in most woods around here and can be fashioned into decent items. The carpenter knows how to work it. I have a hatchet for you, if you're up for it.

option.optiontext: Sure, I'd like a hatchet.
Sorry Darron, another time.

node.text: Aye, sir. If you were planning on making a bow for yourself, you might want to test it by culling some of the deer by the stream. They breed all too rapidly.

option.optiontext: All right, thanks for the tip.

node.text: Hello, master Rothar.

option.optiontext: Greetings, carpenter. What can you tell me about woodworking?
Carry on, carpenter.

node.text: Oh, well probably the best thing you can craft wood into is a bow. Better bows might require more special types of wood, but such wood might be hard to come by.

Spruce tends to grow everywhere around these parts and can be crafted into a fair bow. If you're interested, ask our groundskeeper Darron about chopping some wood. Once you have acquired the wood, you can use the workbench here to make it into a bow.

option.optiontext: All right. Thanks Elliswood, take care!

node.text: Greetings, master!
node.contextBefore: Happens BEFORE this node: when there is no quest dialogue to progress

option.optiontext: Afternoon, carpenter.

node.text: Oh... master Rothar, sir! What can I do for you?

option.optiontext: I'm looking for my children, Sira. Happen to have seen them?
What are you doing in here, Sira? Is everything all right?
Carry on.

node.text: Oh... No, sir. Not since I locked myself in here anyway...

option.optiontext: Right... And why exactly are you hiding in here?
Okay, goodbye then.

node.text: I'm sorry, master. These idiot servants I'm meant to look after are running around like headless chickens - it's all caused me a terrible migraine. I asked Dr. Ben to make one of his migraine potions but it's been hours and he still hasn't come back.

option.optiontext: Don't worry, Sira. If I see the man, I'll tell him to hurry it up.
What ever could be holding him back?
That sounds tough, but I need to go. Good luck.

node.text: Oh I don't know, that man is so lost in daydreaming sometimes it drives me insane! I'm sure he went outside to pick ingredients.

option.optiontext: Could he have got himself hurt?
Okay. Sounds tough but I need to go. Good luck.

node.text: Maybe. I wouldn't be surprised if he managed to spring his ankle while trying to sit on a chair. Oh would you see if he's all right?

option.optiontext: All right, if I see him I'll tell him to hurry it up.
Can't, Sira, got headaches of my own. Good luck.

node.text: Oh thank you, master. I'm sure you'll find him somewhere outside looking for his herbs. He can't have gone far.

option.optiontext: Hang in there.

node.text: Yes, master, what is it?

option.optiontext: Did you happen to see my children at all?
So where should I look for Dr. B?
Nevermind.

node.text: Not since I shut myself in here. Sorry I can't be of more help.

option.optiontext: So where should I look for Dr. B?
Okay, I'll see you later.

node.text: He went outside to look for ingredients, I don't really know more than that. But I'm sure he can't have gone far.

option.optiontext: Did you happen to see my children at all?
Okay, I'll see you later.

node.text: Ah, master Rothar! Hope you're feeling well.

option.optiontext: Never better. What are you doing out here, doctor?
I'm fine, see you around doc.

node.text: Oh well, just picking some berries for my potions. Nice day for it. Hehe.

option.optiontext: I don't see any berries around.
Right. Carry on.

node.text: You don't? Err, no I'm sure there are some! They're just a little bit hidden, that's all.

option.optiontext: There aren't any berries here, doc.
Whatever, carry on.

node.text: Now if you'll excuse me, Lord Rothar, these berries require my full attention, so if there was nothing else?

option.optiontext: Suit yourself.

node.text: Ah, master Rothar! Hope you're feeling well.

option.optiontext: Sira is waiting for her potion, doctor. What's holding you?
I'm fine, see you around doc.

node.text: I know, I know. I'm trying to collect the ingredients for the potion. Just need some more berries...

option.optiontext: But there aren't any berries here!

node.text: No? Are you sure, maybe they're just hiding underneath the flowers.

option.optiontext: Sira said you've been gone for hours, what's going on doctor?
Whatever, good luck with it.

node.text: Ahem, well... It may be that whilst I was looking for the berries, I may have dropped my glasses. And as I tried to find them, it's entirely possible that I stepped on them. I'm quite useless without my glasses, master. What to do?

option.optiontext: Maybe I can help. What ingredients do you need?
Your mess, good luck.

node.text: You would help, master? Splendid! The main body of the potion requires redberries, about five ought to do. You will also need to find a pair of bunny ears and a bit of cave moss.

option.optiontext: I won't even ask, I'll be back with the stuff.
I'll need to know a bit more about those ingredients.
Okay, this sounds terribly tedious. Sorry, you're on your own.

node.text: Master, one other thing. There's no way I will be able to brew the potion considering my current predicament. The alchemist's table is in the study, where that odd wizard fellow currently resides. If you take the ingredients there, I'm sure you'll do just fine.

option.optiontext: I need to brew the potion as well?

node.text: It's quite a straightforward, easy potion to brew, I promise. I'll be here if you have any questions.

option.optiontext: All right then, doc. I'll see what I can do.

node.text: Ask away, my lord.

option.optiontext: Nevermind, I'll be back with the stuff.
So redberries?
Bunny ears? You must be joking.
What's cave moss?

node.text: Oh yes, redberries. Five of them. You can spot them by virtue of them being berries that are red. They tend to grow everywhere! Just... not here, I suppose.

option.optiontext: Okay, I'll be back with the stuff.
And bunny ears? You must be joking.
What's cave moss?

node.text: Not at all! I'll have you know bunny ears have exceptional healing properties. Bunnies are in great abundance too, but acquiring the ears may involve a little brutality, I'm afraid.

option.optiontext: Okay, I'll be back with the stuff.
What about redberries?
What's cave moss?

node.text: Ah, that one may prove a little trickier. My stockpiles only just ran out and I'm not yet familiar enough with the grounds to suggest an exact location for where to look.. All I can say is that cave moss prefers damp, dark, underground conditions to grow.

option.optiontext: Okay, I'll be back with the stuff.
What about redberries?
And bunny ears? You must be joking.

node.text: Greetings, master Rothar! How goes your search for the ingredients?

option.optiontext: I found all you mentioned, so what do I do now?
So I need five redberries?
So I need a pair of bunny ears?
So I need cave moss?
Where's the alchemist's table again?
Nevermind, see you later, doc.

node.text: Well done, sir! I knew you had the knack for this. Since I've lost my glasses, I'd just make a mess if I tried to brew the potion myself. Maybe you should give it a try, sir? Use the alchemist's table in the manor to dissolve those ingredients into the potion.

option.optiontext: Right, I'll see what I can do.

node.text: Oh yes, master. They should be easy to spot and grow in lots of places. Just never on open meadows, come to think of it...

option.optiontext: And bunny ears?
And cave moss?
Where's the alchemist's table again?
All right, I'll go look for them.

node.text: Absolutely, and I'm sure you will have no problem finding bunnies around here. As for the ears themselves... erm... perhaps a sharp knife?

option.optiontext: And five redberries?
And cave moss?
Where's the alchemist's table again?
All right, I'll go look for them.

node.text: Yes, that one might require a bit of exploration. Cave moss typically prefers damp, dark, underground conditions to grow. I'm not entire sure where to find such a cave on the grounds, but perhaps you're more familiar with these lands than I.

option.optiontext: And five redberries?
And bunny ears?
Where's the alchemist's table again?
All right, I'll go look for it.

node.text: Once you have all the ingredients, you can find the alchemist's table in the study where the wizard currently resides. Using the table to dissolve the ingredients into a potion shouldn't be too difficult, as long as you're not blind. Fortunately it's a fairly simple potion we're dealing with.. Other more advanced potions would require a bit more expertise.

option.optiontext: So I need five redberries?
So I need bunny ears?
So I need cave moss?
All right, I'll go look for it.

node.text: Master Rothar, did you have any luck making the potion then?

option.optiontext: Oh yes, Sira's feeling much better already.
Yes, it's all sorted. Now I have other matters to attend to.

node.text: Simply splendid! I'll say master, with some practice you could become quite the potionmaker.

option.optiontext: Even so, you should probably get new glasses, doctor. You're no use to anyone like this.
Yes, yes. I need to go now.

node.text: Ahem, quite right, quite right. I'll see about getting replacements as soon as possible.

option.optiontext: I'll leave you to it, doc.

node.text: Master Rothar? Did you find the doctor then?

option.optiontext: Worry not, Sira, I have your potion.
Not yet.

node.text: Thank goodness, master! *Sira gulps down her migraine potion*
Ah I feel better already, though I think I'll wait here a while more for the potion to do its job. Oh master, I could kiss you!

option.optiontext: Ahem, I don't think Fayle would like that very much.
Yes, I deserve a kiss.

node.text: Oh of course not master, I merely meant to say I'm very thankful.

option.optiontext: Great, I'll see you later Sira.

node.text: Oh? Well of course, though just a little one mind you. Here you go!

option.optiontext: Perfect, I'll see you later Sira.

node.text: Master Rothar, what can I do for you?

option.optiontext: Is the migraine getting better?
Another kiss?
Nevermind, see you later.

node.text: It's definitely getting better, master, thank you. Though I'll stay here and wait it out a little while longer.

option.optiontext: All right, good luck.

node.text: Master, that would be highly inappropriate! It is my duty to remind you that you must stay loyal to your lovely wife, Fayle.

option.optiontext: Of course, what was I thinking? I'll go now.

node.text: Wasn't expecting to see you here today, m'lord. To what do I owe the honor?

option.optiontext: Greetings, Darron. How are the manor grounds?
Just passing, Darron. Carry on.

node.text: Same old, m'lord. Spruce is growing exceptionally well, as always. The carpenter's been pressing me to chop down a few for logs, but I've been too busy trying to deal with all these pesky deer.

option.optiontext: Deer? Why are they causing problems?
Don't worry about the trees, Darron. I could always cut some of them down.
Okay, good luck with them, I need to get going.

node.text: They breed like bunnies, and don't even get me started on actual bunnies. But when there are too many of them around, they cause all sorts of damage to the vegetation, so every year I try to reduce their numbers.
This year's been tougher than usual... They're reacting quicker than before and sprint away even faster. I'm having trouble hunting them down.

option.optiontext: Maybe we'll have an easier time cornering them together?
Tried setting traps?
What could have made the deer this way?
I need to go, but keep at it Darron. I'm sure you'll manage.

node.text: I'm glad you asked, sir. In fact, together with the carpenter, we came up with a creative solution - a crossbow that fires a net to pin them down!

option.optiontext: That's crazy.
Oookay I'm not doing this. Sorry, Darron, you're on your own.

node.text: It's genius! I just need someone to operate the crossbow while I take down the target with my trusty hunting bow, and that's where you come in. Just beware it doesn't have much of a range, so we'll need to conceal ourselves in the vegetation and ambush any that get close enough. What do you say, m'lord?

option.optiontext: Sounds thrilling, I'm in.
Sorry Darron, I'm not doing this, you're on your own.

node.text: Ah well, thought I'd ask. But you know where to find me if you happen to change your mind.
Excellent! Here's the crossbow, and remember what I said - hide and wait for them to come close. I'll be right behind you, sir.

option.optiontext: Let's do this.

node.text: That would be much appreciated, m'lord. You can find a hatchet at my lodge nearby. The carpenter's working away in his hut next to the smithy, bring him any logs you get and I'm sure he'd be delighted.

option.optiontext: So what's this issue you're having with the deer?
Sure. Good luck with the deer.

node.text: The problem with traps is that they don't discriminate. We just want to kill the deer without harming any of the other animals.

option.optiontext: Then maybe we'll have an easier time cornering them together?
What could have made the deer so swift?
Well I should go but keep at it Darron. I'm sure you'll manage.

node.text: Erm, well I have a theory... A few years back you wanted the deer in the park to look majestic, so I started culling only the weaker ones. Now there are only strong and fast deer left.

option.optiontext: Ahem, well maybe we'd have an easier time cornering them together?
What about traps?
Well I should go but keep at it Darron. I'm sure you'll manage.

node.text: Yes, m'lord?

option.optiontext: How do we get close enough to strike?
How does this damn crossbow work?
Shush, Darron, you'll scare away the deer.

node.text: We'll let the deer come to us, we just need a good spot to hide.

option.optiontext: I see.

node.text: 'ere, let me show you.
*This crossbow has a special attack; you can activate it by klikking teh special button or pressing teh special key.*

option.optiontext: Ah ye ofc, it's pretty obvious actually.

node.text: That's the last one for now, excellent job sir! I'll be getting back to my lodge now. Do hold onto that crossbow, sir, I have a feeling we'll need it again next year.

option.optiontext: All right, see you later Darron.

node.text: Welcome back, m'lord.

option.optiontext: So the deer situation is now under control?
You mentioned the spruce earlier?
See you later, Darron.

node.text: Quite so, sir. But feel free to chase down more of them if you're so inclined, we have a very healthy deer population. And if you're truly into hunting, you could always craft a proper hunting bow at the carpenter's hut.

option.optiontext: A hunting bow? How would I make one of those?
When we spoke earlier, you mentioned something about spruce.
Right then, see you later Darron.

node.text: Oh yes, m'lord. As you know, spruce grows very eagerly on the grounds and can be fashioned into all sorts of useful items. All you need is a hatchet to fell the trees, I have one right here by the lodge of course.

option.optiontext: What could I use the spruce for?
All right, take care Darron.

node.text: A proper hunting bow for one thing, but that's about all I know. If you take any logs you collect to the carpenter's hut, next to the smithy, I'm sure the carpenter could tell you a lot more than I.

option.optiontext: I see. All right Darron, take care.

node.text: Well, sir, if you're curious then I suggest you grab the hatchet over there and chop down a few spruce trees, they grow on the grounds in abundance. Take the logs to the carpenter's hut next to the smithy and he'll tell you more.

option.optiontext: I see. All right Darron, take care.

node.text: Oh, hi father!

option.optiontext: Hello my little daughter. What are you doing all the way here in the woods?
Chaerie?! You're not supposed to be out here, get back to the manor right now!

node.text: I'm collecting acorns, father! Some of them are really unusual, those are the best ones!

option.optiontext: You know, we're hosting a banquet tonight. You should get back inside and get yourself ready.
And what exactly are you collecting acorns for?

node.text: But father...! I've not finished my acorn collection yet! I can't just leave without my acorns...

option.optiontext: Let's make a deal - I'll help you collect acorns and you'll be on your best behavior for the banquet?

node.text: Yes! That would be perfect! I already found a bunch of really good looking ones, but there was a wolf guarding them. It gave me a mean growl, so I ran off.

option.optiontext: Really, a wolf guarding acorns? Now why would it do that?
Riiiight, because that's what wolves do. Just tell me where to find these acorns.

node.text: Well, the acorn clearing is just a little further south into the woods from here. But you'll need to chase the wolf away so be careful.

option.optiontext: Okay, whatever you say.

node.text: Ugh... I told you already! They were really good looking acorns!
Exactly! So... If you chase the acorn wolf off and collect the acorns for me, my collection would be complete. Would you do that for me, father? Pleeeaaaase...?

option.optiontext: Fine, but then you'll be a good obedient daughter afterwards.

node.text: Yes, I promise! The acorn clearing is just a little further south into the woods from here.
node.contextAfter: Happens AFTER this node: Chaerish quest is updated to defeat the acorn wolf and collect 6 good looking acorns

option.optiontext: Okay. I'll be right back.

node.text: You're back, father! Did you get the acorns?
node.contextBefore: Happens BEFORE this node: returning with the acorns

option.optiontext: Yeah I did, but there really was a wolf guarding them! Unbelievable.
No, not yet.

node.text: Yes, father, I told you! Now, the acorns?

option.optiontext: I have them right here.

node.text: Excellent! These are really good looking ones, well done! You deserve a reward.

option.optiontext: I deserve a reward, do I?

node.text: Yes, father. I'm old enough to know adventurers need to be well rewarded when they do something for you. You can have some of the other acorns I've found. These are really unusual looking ones, I'm sure they will bring you luck.
node.contextAfter: Happens AFTER this node: an unusual acorn is added to the inventory

option.optiontext: I see. Thank you, pumpkin. Now you need to get back home and change to some decent clothes.

node.text: At once, father!
node.contextAfter: Happens AFTER this node: Chaerish quest is completed

node.text: You're back, father! Did you get the acorns?
node.contextBefore: Happens BEFORE this node: returning with the acorns

option.optiontext: No, not yet.

node.text: Don't talk to me like that! Or I'll... I'll run off and hide in the woods and won't come back all day!

option.optiontext: What are you doing out here anyway?
But I've told you, these woods aren't safe for you to play in!

node.text: I'm not a little baby anymore, I know how to look after myself. I've even tried making friends with one of the wolves. I think she'll come around, eventually.

option.optiontext: No, no, no! You need to stay away from the wolves!

node.text: Because I like acorns, they're pretty. And I swear, sometimes it feels like some of them are downright magical.

option.optiontext: Okay. But we're hosting a banquet tonight so I need you to get back to the manor now.

node.text: Ugh, you're so annoyingly overprotective sometimes. Most of the wolves are fine, really. It's just a few of them that don't like me collecting acorns.

option.optiontext: You can be so stubborn sometimes... Please get back to the manor and start getting ready for tonight's banquet.
Why do you need to be collecting acorns anyway?

node.text: Hello, master Rothar.

option.optiontext: Greetings Elisa! Happen to have seen the children around?
Greetings! How's everything going?
Carry on.

node.text: Hah, I wish! But has the young master forgotten these eyes don't see much at all anymore?

option.optiontext: Ah, right. Has your eyesight been giving you difficulties lately?
Sorry, that's right. I'll leave you to it.

node.text: I've been tailoring clothes all my life, young master. It's in the fingers by now. Though there is one thing, if you're keen to help.

option.optiontext: Of course, name it.
The servants can help you, I'm a little busy.

node.text: I was about to patch some of the childrens' clothes but I ran into a bit of an obstacle. You see, my trusty sewing kit is in that locked chest in the corner, but I can't remember for the life of me where I left the key! I'd be really grateful if you could return my sewing kit to me.

option.optiontext: Sure, I'll see if I can find the key.
You have no memory of where the key might be?
I'm really sorry I don't have the time. Maybe one of the servants can help.

node.text: Thank you, master. Oh and the key you're looking for, it's an old rusty looking one.

option.optiontext: All right.

node.text: Well, no. But I'm sure it's somewhere in the house.

option.optiontext: I'll see if I can find it.
I'm really sorry I don't have the time. Maybe one of the servants can help.

node.text: Hello, master Rothar.

option.optiontext: Greetings Elisa! Happen to have seen the children around?
About the key to your chest, do you have any clues at all?
Carry on.

node.text: Hah, I wish! But has the young master forgotten these eyes don't see much at all anymore?

option.optiontext: That's right, I keep forgetting. Nevermind.
How silly of me. About the key to your chest, do you have any clues at all?

node.text: Well... I'm sure I've left it in the house. And it's an old rusty looking key, in case you happen to try a wrong key on the lock.
Any luck with the chest at all?

option.optiontext: Not to worry, Elisa. I have your sewing kit.
Not right now.

node.text: That is simply marvelous, young master. While you were away that odd wizard came around asking about robes. I'm preoccupied with the childrens' clothes, but there's wool cloth on the table if you're feeling up for the challenge.

option.optiontext: That shouldn't be a problem. You know how comfortable I am with the needle.
You think I could make robes? Sounds daunting.

node.text: I know master, you were taught by meself after all. That's why I'm asking. Just take the cloth to the sewing table and see what you can do.

option.optiontext: Okay, I'll show you the robes once I'm done.

node.text: Don't worry, young master. I'll be right here looking over your shoulder. Just take the cloth to the sewing table and see what you can do.

option.optiontext: Okay, I'll show you the robes once I'm done.

node.text: Did you have a go at making the robes, young master?

option.optiontext: What do you make of these robes, Elisa?
What do I need to do exactly?
Not yet.

node.text: You can find wool cloth on the table. Just bring it to the sewing table and get to work. The rest will take care of itself, I promise.

option.optiontext: Oh, okay.

node.text: Let me feel them... Hmm, yes... Not bad, young master, not bad at all. I suppose you could try offering these to the wizard... Or maybe hold onto them if you wish to practice magic.

option.optiontext: Excellent. This definitely sharpened my tailoring skills.

node.text: No doubt about it. Feel free to use the sewing table as much as you like, if you're looking for more practice.

option.optiontext: Sure. Catch you later, Elisa.

node.text: Hello again, master Rothar.

option.optiontext: Greetings Elisa! Happen to have seen the children around?
So you've had me make robes. What else can tailors do?
Catch you later, Elisa.

node.text: Oh, well... That is such a complicated question... Where to even begin?

option.optiontext: Ugh, forget I asked.

node.text: Hah, I wish! But has the young master forgotten these eyes don't see much at all anymore?

option.optiontext: This is true, I forgot. So you've had me make robes. What else can tailors do?
True, I forgot. Catch you later, Elisa.

node.text: Greetings, traveler. I am Dr. Joe, revered for my excellence in treating every ailment, if I do say so myself. Believe me when I say you are in safe hands. Trust me, I'm a doctor. Now...
Tell me, what is it that troubles you today?

option.optiontext: Sore tooth, doctor.
Doctor, my head hurts.
Doctor, I have the cold... *cough*
Infection and inflammation, doctor.
I... I lost my job, doctor...
Actually, doctor, I believe I'm just fine.

node.text: Indeed. So common, alas, so painful. Fear not, I have just the thing for you - alcohol. Try this bottle of gin, for instance. A generous sip every other minute, hold in your mouth a few seconds and swallow. The effects are immediate.

option.optiontext: Thank you, doctor.

node.text: Oh yes, the headache, the eternal bane of the human existence. Now, the remedy for this is somewhat more complex, but the results speak for themselves I assure you. You must follow these steps carefully...

option.optiontext: Yes, doctor?

node.text: First step, you take this bottle of whiskey...
Second step, you open the bottle...

option.optiontext: With you so far.

node.text: Third step, you take a good, long sip...

option.optiontext: I see...

node.text: And the final step, you close the bottle and return to step one at your leisure.

option.optiontext: Ah, I think I got it doctor. Thank you, I shall follow your instructions to the letter.

node.text: Ahhh, luckily for you, the cold is easily defeated. All you need is a strong dose of rum to be administered every so often during the day. You will have shrugged it off before long.

option.optiontext: Thank you, doctor.

node.text: Hmm, indeed... indeed... I shall have to think about this a moment...
Indeed... Now this case calls for something more exotic - brandy. I advice a full bottle each day until the problem no longer persists.
Oof... that weighs heavy on the heart. I want you to know that I sympathise, I'm here for you, and there is a cure for your pain. Wine, several bottles of it, to be consumed until you pass out.
Come see me again if the symptoms do not disappear within the next few days, we may need to prescribe a little whiskey on the side, but let's hope it doesn't come to that.

option.optiontext: Thank you, doctor.

node.text: One treatment ought to do it, but don't be surprised if you find yourself needing two or even three sessions, it's perfectly normal.

option.optiontext: Thank you, doctor.

node.text: Truly? Well in that case might I advise you to enjoy your day along with some beer?

option.optiontext: Thank you doctor, I will.

node.text: What? Please go away.

option.optiontext: Who are you?
You're Baryten Malachis? Birna at Haywind told me you have Managrapes.

node.text: I am the Arcane Botanist of Hydrobor and I am very busy with my work. Go away.

option.optiontext: What's an Arcane Botanist?
I'll leave you be.
You're Baryten Malachis? Birna at Haywind told me you have Managrapes.

node.text: *sigh*\nYou're going to just keep pestering me with your questions aren't you? Fine, the quicker I answer the sooner you will go away.
The Arcane Botanist is responsible for the handling and care of magical flora, of course. Through the gates behind us you will find my life's work - my Managardens. Remember not to touch anything!

option.optiontext: I'm looking for Managrapes. Managardens sounds like the kind of place where they might grow.
How interesting. Tell me about these gardens.
Okay then. Goodbye.

node.text: That's right, Managrapes grow on the Blueleaf Aspen. Difficult trees to grow under the best of circumstances and I have many in my garden. But their fruit is not for outsiders!

option.optiontext: Really? You wouldn't make an exception?
Fine, whatever.

node.text: Of course not! Only a true friend of Hydrobor could be allowed to pick the grapes. So I would only consider allowing you to have them if you managed to befriend one of us.

option.optiontext: Could I be your friend?
I see. Goodbye then.
But I made friends with Birna Cloudlight in Haywind.

node.text: Preposterous! I don't have any friends.

option.optiontext: How sad. So what can you tell me about your gardens?
Me neither. Goodbye.
I made friends with Birna Cloudlight in Haywind. Does that count?

node.text: Ah, well the centerpiece behind the gates is an Arcane Everbloom. A very small tree in nature, but over the years I've unlocked its true potential. Powerful magical currents flow through that one now, all in service of the Academy.

option.optiontext: Alright, I've heard enough. Goodbye.

node.text: Past the Arcane Everbloom, several Blueleaf Aspens. They bear the fruit that is every wizard's best friend - Managrapes. Only someone with my set of skills could ever hope to successfully grow these maginificent trees.

option.optiontext: Wait, you grow Managrapes? I'm looking for some.
Alright, I've heard enough. Goodbye.

node.text: The southern section of the gardens is a leisurely park, nothing too exceptional grows there. Though, to my pride, I have managed to attract some faes into it. Faes are very picky about where they choose to live, you know.

option.optiontext: So you grow Managrapes? I'm interested in obtaining some.
Very interesting, but I must be going now. Goodbye.

node.text: Why, hello there traveler!

option.optiontext: Greetings! Nice weather for farming, am I right?

node.text: Sure is traveler! 'Course the weather witch at the village helps with that.

option.optiontext: Weather witch?
So what are you farming?
I'll leave you to it.

node.text: Aye, Birna something or other. Nice lass, in my younger years I might've even fancied her.

option.optiontext: So what are you farming?
I see. Well, I'll be off. Good day to you!

node.text: Ah y'know, mostly 'taters and 'maters and such.

option.optiontext: Excuse me?
Sounds about right. I'll leave you to it.

node.text: 'Taters and 'maters, traveler.

option.optiontext: You mean to say potatoes and tomatoes?
Uh, okay. Goodbye.

node.text: Like I said, 'taters and 'maters.

option.optiontext: No see, PO-TA-TO...
Have it your way.
Ugh, whatever.

node.text: Grrreeeetingsss, weary travellarr. Welcome to the shop of Master Alchemist Xerxes Alexxander Xalaxar himself. I am he, who divines the truth. He, who looks past the nebulous mysteries of the universe with clarity... With purity of mind... And sees that which is the only thing that matters - matter itself.
node.contextBefore: Happens BEFORE this node: while having the 'rude awakening; mageseed oil' quest active

option.optiontext: Greetings to you, ermm... Xergsus... Alex... Hmm... Master Alchemist. I am Rothar.
So what? You brew potions?
Ooookay, I don't want to deal with this right now.

node.text: Both your name, and mine, are inconsequential, traveler. Only the matter, which you seek, concerns me. Perhaps you seek the secrets of transmutation and mutation? Perhaps you seek to enter the gates of heaven? Perhaps it is control and power you seek, hm? Or...

option.optiontext: Actually I'm in need of Mageseed Oil.
You can do all that?
Gates of Heaven? Point me to them.

node.text: ... I... I beg your pardon...? You come to the great Xerxes... looking for something as trivial as... Mageseed Oil?

option.optiontext: Can you make it?
Am I wasting my time here?

node.text: Can I make it...? Oh I think I'm going to faint...

Sigh... Very well. The great Xerxes will make for you... Mageseed Oil... However, it will cost you in both time and coin. To make the oil, I will require a handful of Arcane Everbloom seeds and a pristine Mageflower petal.

option.optiontext: These sound like rather special ingredients, where could I find them?
Umm. Okay, nevermind. Maybe I'll talk to you later.

node.text: Special? They're not special. At least not to someone like myself, the great Xerxes. But indeed, they only grow in forests closely attuned to the realms of magic. I suppose such places are rare enough in the world, when you think about it.

But lucky for you, it is by no coincidence that the great Xerxes chose to place his residence here. We stand literally surrounded by one such enchanted forest. Locals call it the Oldroot Forest, but that's of no importance to me. People come and go, names change, but this forest has stood here throughout and will continue to do so long after we're gone.

option.optiontext: Anything more you can tell me about those ingredients for the oil? What am I looking for exactly?
You mentioned that coin is required?
By the way, I'm looking for Spellbound Bark. Is that something I can find in the forest?
Should I keep an eye out for wild beasts while exploring the forest?
Great, I'll be back with those ingredients.

node.text: I beg your pardon?! The great Xerxes does not *simply* brew potions! What do you take me for? Some common... common... potion making... potioner? No! I am a master craftsman and an artisan, a diviner of truth, a...

option.optiontext: Mageseed Oil, can you make it?
Really? So what can you do exactly?

node.text: Not really, beasts are wary of enchanted forests - such places are too unnatural. Besides, their prey stay away all the same. You will find fae-folk though, who aren't exactly aggressive but peculiar and unpredicatable. Do beware of the treants though - the caretakers of the forest. They're trees that at some point got a little too in touch with magic and sprung to conscious life.

option.optiontext: Treants? Are they hostile?
Anything more you can tell me about those ingredients for the oil? What am I looking for exactly?
So you mentioned that coin is required?
Okay. I'm looking for Spellbound Bark, is that something I can find in the forest?
All right, I'll be back with the ingredients.

node.text: I suppose you could use my setup here to practice. Grinding bones into fine dust with the pestle and mortar is a great way to start, and bone dust can be further fashioned into simple potions for a bit of experience. Kill rabbits for bones if you need to. That's what I do.

option.optiontext: Right. I'm looking for Spellbound Bark, is that something I can find in the forest?
So you mentioned that coin is required?
Should I keep an eye out for wild beasts while exploring the forest?
All right, I'll be back with the ingredients.

node.text: Not normally, as long as you behaved respectfully. Recently though, many have gone to pillage the forest's treasures in hopes of selling whatever they find to the magi of Hydrobor. Needless to say, the treants have become somewhat more aggressive since then.

option.optiontext: Anything more you can tell me about those ingredients for the oil? What am I looking for exactly?
So you mentioned that coin is required?
Okay. I'm looking for Spellbound Bark, is that something I can find in the forest?
That's fine. I'll be back with the ingredients.

node.text: The Arcane Everbloom is a tree especially in tune with magical currents. They're usually quite small, but easily recognisable by their stark purple leaves. The Mageflower on the other hand grows all over the forest's small clearings, but not all of them develop pedals that are of pristine condition, so be prepared to pick a few. Either way, you'll need some experience with handling delicate alchemical ingredients to pick these without destroying them.

option.optiontext: I see. What would be the best way to practice?
Okay. I'm looking for Spellbound Bark, is that something I can find in the forest?
So you mentioned that coin is required?
Should I keep an eye out for wild beasts while exploring the forest?
All right, I'll be back with the ingredients.

node.text: Well then that's tough. Good luck finding anyone else out here who can brew the oil for you. Even the ''oh so mighty'' wizards of Hydrobor approach the magnificent Xerxes for that service.

option.optiontext: Anything more you can tell me about those ingredients? What am I looking for exactly?
I'm looking for Spellbound Bark, is that something I can find in the forest?
Should I keep an eye out for wild beasts while exploring the forest?
All right then, I'll be back with the ingredients.

node.text: Spellbound Bark? Now that is certainly more special. But indeed, the Oldroot forest is a treasure trove for the magical botanist. Deep within the heart of the forest, a Spellbound Oak grows. Some measure of skill with the hatchet is required to even chip away pieces of the oak's bark. And delude yourself not; some of the more powerful treants will be guarding it with their lives.

option.optiontext: Anything more you can tell me about those ingredients for the oil? What am I looking for exactly?
So you mentioned that coin is required?
Should I keep an eye out for wild beasts while exploring the forest?
All right, I'll be back with the ingredients.

node.text: Of course it is! Or perhaps you thought the great Xerxes Alexxander Xalaxar is a charity, who gives out his services freely, hm? Then you would have been mistaken. I will require a payment of 40 gold coins for every bottle of Mageseed Oil, in addition to the ingredients you bring me.

option.optiontext: 40 gold for one bottle? That seems steep.
Anything more you can tell me about those ingredients? What am I looking for exactly?
Right. I'm looking for Spellbound Bark, is that something I can find in the forest?
Should I keep an eye out for wild beasts while exploring the forest?
All right then, I'll be back with the ingredients.

node.text: Well perhaps not yet, but I am destined to uncover all the world's secrets! With the proper research, anything is possible and...!

option.optiontext: I'm in need of Mageseed Oil, can you make it?
So really you are only good for potions?

node.text: Eh? It's all figuratively speaking of course, but I am able to brew a potion that will send you to a drooling bliss. Although as a side effect, you lose all memory of that blissful state once the potion wears off. I stopped selling them after the idiot peasantry accused me of fraud. Can you believe it? My potions are exceptional!

option.optiontext: I see. Well in that case you'll be able to brew Mageseed Oil for me!
I don't know, so far all I hear is big words. Are you even able to actually brew anything?

node.text: What can't I do, you should ask! Perhaps you seek the secrets of transmutation and mutation? Perhaps you seek to enter the gates of heaven? Perhaps it is control and power you seek, hm? Or...

option.optiontext: Actually I'm in need of Mageseed Oil.
You can do all that?
Gates of Heaven? Point me to them.

node.text: How dare you! Alchemy isn't just about potions, it's about understanding all aspects of the universe. It's about knowledge and power!

option.optiontext: And sometimes it's about making Mageseed Oil. Would you do that for me?
That's great, but can you actually brew anything for real?

node.text: I'll have you know there are very few potions in existence that are unknown to me. How about a challenge, hm? Name a potion, and I shall demonstrate my tremendous ability.

option.optiontext: How about Mageseed Oil? Is that something you can make?
I have better things to do, goodbye Xerxes.

node.text: I'm afraid you have it the other way around; it is you who is wasting my time with such triviality.
Oh, it's you again. Any luck collecting those plants then?

option.optiontext: I have them. Will you make the oil now?
I'd like to see what potions you have for sale.
I had some questions about that.
Picking the plants intact is trickier than I expected, how could I improve my skill?
You're not from Imberthale are you? How does an expert alchemist end up all the way here?
Not yet, I'll be back later.

node.text: That depends. Do you also have the coin to pay for it?

option.optiontext: Yes, fine! Take your gold! (pay 40)
You won't consider waiving your fees this once?
Well I don't have that much on me right now...

node.text: Perfect! This won't take but a moment from someone of my abilities. I'll just extract the oil from the seeds... like so... and infuse it with the petal... And there - one bottle of Mageseed Oil, as requested!

option.optiontext: Thanks, that'll be all.
That's it?

node.text: Very well, don't hesitate to approach the grreat Xerxes again should you require anything more special made. Just remember to bring coin!

option.optiontext: I'll see you later, Xerxes.

node.text: Yes, that's it. No explosions, sparkles or rainbow colored smoke. What were you expecting? You come to the exceptional Xerxes himself and request Mageseed Oil, then have the audacity to be disappointed by the lack of drama. I swear, one of these days...

option.optiontext: Okay, please stop talking. I'll just take the oil then.

node.text: Waive my fee?! Wouldn't you just like that, but no, that's a ridiculous suggestion. Besides, if I made an exception for you, I'd soon have the peasants lining up outside my house for potions on credit. I hate peasants...

option.optiontext: Oh well, thought I'd ask. Here's your gold. (pay 40)
But I don't have that much on me right now...

node.text: Well too bad! The great Xerxes is no servant to beggars! Come back when you have the coin.

option.optiontext: Fine, but can I see what potions you have for sale?
Tell me, how does an expert alchemist end up all the way up here?
I'll be back later.

node.text: But you just told me you're out of coin! Get out of here!

option.optiontext: Oh, okay.

node.text: Indeed, I might have a few curious bottles in stock I might part with, given the appropriate compensation...
Oh? Speak then.

option.optiontext: Tell me about the ingredients for the Mageseed Oil. What am I looking for exactly?

node.text: Oh? Speak then.

node.text: Indeed, you'll need some experience with handling delicate alchemical ingredients to pick the plants without destroying them. I suppose you could use my setup here to practice; grinding bones into fine dust with the pestle and mortar is a great way to start, and bone dust can be further fashioned into simple potions for a bit of experience. Kill rabbits for bones if you need to. That's what I do.

option.optiontext: I see. I had other questions for you, master alchemist.
I'd like to see what potions you have for sale.
You're not from Imberthale, are you? How does an expert alchemist end up all the way here?
All right, thanks.

node.text: That's none of you business! Get going already!

option.optiontext: Oh, okay.

node.text: You again? I sincerely hope you're looking to purchase a potion or two, my pockets are light enough concerning coin.

option.optiontext: Sure, let me see what you've got.
I need more Mageseed Oil.
You're not from Imberthale are you? How does an expert alchemist end up all the way here?
Tell me about the Oldroot Forest?

node.text: Then you know what I expect. Three Arcane Everbloom seeds, a pristine Mageflower petal and 40 gold coins. Brought everything with you?

No, I'll be back when I do.

node.text: Then why are you even talking to me?

option.optiontext: I'd like to see what potions you have for sale.
You're not from Imberthale are you? How does an expert alchemist end up all the way here?

node.text: Perfect! I'll just extract the oil from the seeds... like so... and infuse it with the petal... And there - one bottle of Mageseed Oil, as requested!

option.optiontext: Another one?
You're not from Imberthale are you? How does an expert alchemist end up all the way here?

node.text: Sure! I'll just extract the oil from the seeds... like so... and infuse it with the petal... And there - one bottle of Mageseed Oil, as requested!

option.optiontext: Another one?
You're not from Imberthale are you? How does an expert alchemist end up all the way here?

node.text: I have better things to do.

option.optiontext: I'd like to see what potions you have for sale.
I need more Mageseed Oil.
You're not from Imberthale are you? How does an expert alchemist end up all the way here?
Okay, I'll just go.

node.text: That's none of you business! Get going already!

option.optiontext: Oh, okay.

node.text: Me nanny used to talk. Talk, talk, talk. One day she talk too much, so me smashed 'er head in with a stone. Didn't talk no more, hah! Gonna do same with you.
Okay, we're done with you. Now why you still here? Bugger off!
Hobert kills team mate, then fite

option.optiontext: oh, oke

node.text: Did I ask you for your stupid name, stupid? NO!

option.optiontext: Actually you did, I just didn't get the chance to answer.
Nevermind, I came here to talk about Opticus.

node.text: Yeh, ya did actually ask who he was, boss. Says his name's Rowther, boss.
You say what now? You think I don't know what I'm saying?! You calling me stooopid?!
Na, boss! I didn't mean...

option.optiontext: You seem pretty stupid to me...
That's exactly what he meant! Are you gonna let him get away with that?!

node.text: NOBODY... CALLS ME... STOOOPID!!! RAAAAARGH!!!
Now what d'ya want? You wanna give us your gold, yeh?

option.optiontext: The man in the cage is Opticus, isn't he? I need him back at his workshop.
How about a sword in your gut instead?
If you'd let me speak, my name is Rothar.

node.text: That didn't sound like a 'YE' to me, did it boys? Lemme ask again, YOU WANNA GIVE US YOUR GOLD, YE?!

option.optiontext: I see I'm wasting my breath. Let's do this then.
Uhh... You really don't just want to talk about this, do you?

node.text: Get 'im, boys!
Oh thank you stranger, thank you so much! Hubert was always a rotten apple, but I didn't think even he would sink so low as this.
node.contextBefore: Happens BEFORE this node: after fightin

option.optiontext: You're Opticus Aluminar? I need you to produce something for me.
What did he want with you, anyway?

node.text: He came to my workshop demanding riches. After he discovered I had little in the way of gold to steal, he got it in his head that I should sell all my equipment and give him the profits. Naturally, I told him to piss off.

option.optiontext: I gather he didn't take too kindly to that.
I'm actually here because I need you to produce something for me.

node.text: Hah! No... he did not. He started tearing down my workshop and threatened to sell me off to slavery. I guess he would have done it too, but I don't actually think he knew who to sell me to, so he just kept me in that cage. Good thing you came along when you did.
I am, in the flesh. Now if you wouldn't terribly mind, could you please let me out of this damn cage?

option.optiontext: Oh yeah, right, of course.

node.text: Thank you, I've had just about enough of this camp. Come see me back at my workshop; we can talk more there, agreed?

option.optiontext: Alright, I'll meet you there.

node.text: He was getting bored and frustrated after he realized he wasn't getting much out of me, but I don't think he was about to let me walk back home either. He dumped a bunch of my stuff over the cliff there, thought for sure I'd be going next.

option.optiontext: I'm actually here because I need you to produce something for me.

node.text: Not just here out of the goodness of your heart then, eh? I've had enough of this camp, though; come see me back at my workshop and we can talk more there - agreed?

option.optiontext: Alright then, I'll meet you there.

node.text: Oh, I guess you could call me a lot of things. An inventor, a craftsman... a man of science, perhaps? Whatever it is, it's something these peasants aren't always able to appreciate.

option.optiontext: Why stay here, if you're not respected?
So how's it going with the workshop?
Alright, let me see what you have for sale.
Alright, take care now.

node.text: Ah, well... it's where my roots are and where would I go? Besides, folk are gonna be more or less the same anywhere, anyway.

option.optiontext: How's it going with the workshop?
Alright, let me see what you have for sale.
Alright, take care now.

node.text: Still trying to piece together a lot of the stuff Hubert and his goons broke, but getting back on my feet thanks to you. Bloody Hubert...

option.optiontext: Tell me Opticus; what do you do, exactly?
Alright, let me see what you have for sale.
Alright, take care now.

node.text: What a bloody mess... Bloody Hubert... Should have built the crossbow like I was planning to...

option.optiontext: Greetings, Opticus.

node.text: Ah, welcome! And apologies for the mess, Hubert was an incapable man in most things, but he did have a talent for breaking stuff.
So, during all that tussle, I never got to hear who I have to thank for saving my life.

option.optiontext: I'm Rothar Aercrest and I'm in need of a focusing crystal.
I saved you because I need something - a focusing crystal.

node.text: Aercrest, eh...? Old name that, old but not entirely forgotten - not by all. But anyway, a focusing crystal? Magi always seem short on those and why? Do they just break them all the time? Who knows...
Let me see see... I should have a few in store, provided that Hubert didn't smash them to bits...

Aha, here we go! This one's on me - I do owe you my life after all. Tell you what, take this medical bag too. I designed it to fit a few potions into it; inconvenient little things to carry around without a proper bag I've found.

option.optiontext: So, who are you exactly?
Thanks, that's all I needed.

node.text: I see... Well yes, I do make those crystals. Magi always seem short on those and why? Do they just break them all the time? Who knows...
Oh, I guess you could call me a lot of things. An inventor, a craftsman... a man of science, perhaps? Whatever it is, it's something these peasants aren't always able to appreciate.

option.optiontext: Why stay here, if you're not respected?
I see, talk more later.

node.text: Ah, well... it's where my roots are and where would I go? Besides, folk are gonna be more or less the same anywhere, anyway.

option.optiontext: I see, talk more later.

node.text: Master Aercrest, welcome as always! What can I help you with?

option.optiontext: I'm here on business about some ghosts...
Let's go over the materials I'll be needing for that priest's lantern again.
Wanted to see what you have for sale.
Tell me Opticus; what do you do, exactly?
How's it going with the workshop?
Nothing for now, thanks.

node.text: Welcome back, friend. What can I help you with?

Let's go over the materials I'll be needing for that priest's lantern again.
Wanted to see what you have for sale.

node.text: Welcome to Haywind traveler! Remember to keep the peace; we don't want any more trouble around here than what we've already got.

option.optiontext: I've found the scene of a crime!
I'm looking for the workshop of a man named Opticus.
I'm in need of a special crystal, know where to find something like that?
I'm looking for a bottle of Mistywood Dew, where could I buy one?
Can you tell me something about Haywind?
What troubles are you experiencing?
Alright, I'll be on my way then.

node.text: Oh, who done what now?

option.optiontext: Opticus the inventor is missing and his workshop's been broken into!

node.text: Oh, that sounds tricky, hmm... what to do, what to do...?

option.optiontext: Aren't you supposed to uphold the law, protect the citizens and all that?

node.text: Hmm... no, I'm not sure I can do anything about that... this sounds way above me... What are you going to do?

option.optiontext: You're expecting me to deal with this?
Okay, I should probably talk to your superior.

node.text: That's an excellent idea! You look way more equipped for this than I am! But before you get started with your investigation, you should probably talk to Marshal Harrington.
He's kind of the man in charge of maintaining order around here. We're constructing a fort at the northern end of Haywind, right by the wharf. You should find the Marshal there.

option.optiontext: Right then.

node.text: What an excellent idea! Marshal Harrington will surely know what to do!
Ah yeah, that weirdo. His house is right by the old mine in southwestern Haywind.

option.optiontext: I'm also looking for a bottle of Mistywood Dew, where could I buy one?
Can you tell me something about Haywind?
What are these troubles you mentioned?
Alright, thanks.

node.text: Ask away.

option.optiontext: I've found the scene of a crime!
I'm looking for the workshop of a man named Opticus.
I'm in need of a special crystal, know where to find something like that?
I'm looking for a bottle of Mistywood Dew, where could I buy one?
Can you tell me something about Haywind?

node.text: Our city's grown even larger than Thornhill in recent decades, but at heart most of us are still simple peace-loving farmer-folk. What would you like to know?

option.optiontext: Where can I buy and sell supplies?
I'm looking for a tavern.
Is there a bank?
Actually, I wanted to ask something else.
Nevermind, I'll be going now.

node.text: Marissa has her general store by the marketplace in northcentral Haywind, but you can find plenty of specialized vendors along the streets too. Most respectable merchants prefer sticking to northern Haywind, mind you. You might also want to see the artisan orders board by the marketplace.
Hmm, you look a bit pale, so maybe you'll also want to see the healer in northwest of the city. Or maybe those magi of Hydrobor on the northeastern side, if you have ailments of magical nature.

option.optiontext: What about a tavern?
Is there a bank?
I had another question.
Alright, thanks.

node.text: There's the Singing Sparrow in southeast Haywind, Melissae there can fix you with something to eat and drink. Also, if you're looking to earn a few coins, folk are known to meet at the tavern for odd jobs.

option.optiontext: Where can I buy and sell supplies?
Is there a bank?
I had another question.
Alright, thanks.

node.text: Absolutely! Master Thurlow's fine new Prosperwind Bank can be found near the marketplace in eastern Haywind.

option.optiontext: Where can I buy and sell supplies?
What about a tavern?
I had another question.
Alright, thanks.

node.text: Bandits and marauders preying on our good fortune! They've badly terrorized the fields to the west, but the Lord-Mayor of Thornhill sent Marshal Harrington down here to resolve the situation. He'll have the thugs straightened out in no time.

option.optiontext: I've found the scene of a crime!
I'm looking for the workshop of a man named Opticus.
I'm in need of a special crystal, know where to find something like that?
I'm looking for a bottle of Mistywood Dew, where could I buy one?
Can you tell me something about Haywind?

node.text: Hmm, whenever I need anything I just talk to Marissa. She has a general store by the marketplace in northcentral Haywind and her crates are always stocked full of random stuff.

option.optiontext: I'm also looking for a bottle of Mistywood Dew, where could I buy one?
Can you tell me something about Haywind?
What are these troubles you mentioned?
Alright, thanks.

node.text: Ah, well... Normally I'd direct you to the general store, or the tavern maybe. But nobody's been able to get a hold of a bottle for a while now, so it might be best to check Barnsmill's estate east of the city. That's where the stuff is made.

option.optiontext: Anyway, I've found the scene of a crime!
I'm also looking for the workshop of a man named Opticus.
I'm also in need of a special crystal, know where to find something like that?
Can you tell me something about Haywind?
What are these troubles you mentioned?
Alright, I'll be on my way then.

node.text: That girl has such a big mouth. Why not announce to all the world: ''Free managrapes for everyone at Hydrobor!''? But she's not the one who has to grow them, is she? What does she think, that managrapes grow on trees? Well they do, but that's not the point! It requires hard work and patience to make them grow.

option.optiontext: I just want the grapes and I'll be away, thank you.
I see. Is there something I could do to help?

node.text: Of course you did, that girl wants to be friends with everyone. Oh fine, but I can't give managrapes to just anyone. You think these grapes grow on trees? Well they do, but that's not the point! It requires hard work and patience to make them grow.

option.optiontext: I just want the grapes and I'll be away, thank you.
I see. Is there something I could do to help?

node.text: Preposterous! If you want the grapes, you will have to prove that you're a true friend of Hydrobor.

option.optiontext: I'm a friend.
What can I do?

node.text: Shush, you need to prove it. Through the gates behind us you will find my Managardens and its centerpiece - the majestic Arcane Everbloom. The tree's magics have seeped into the surrounding wellspring.
Collect the arcane water and take it to the Blueleaf Aspens on the other side. Then, simply water the trees.

option.optiontext: That's it? That doesn't sounds too difficult.
Sure. But first, I had a few questions.
Okay, I'll be back when it's done.

node.text: Well then, what are you wating for? Chop chop!

option.optiontext: A few questions before I go.
I'm on it.
Tell me about what it is you do here.
Tell me about these Managardens.
Could you repeat my task again?

node.text: I suppose I would allow you to collect managrapes if you helped me care for the trees they grow on. Through the gates behind us you will find my Managardens and its centerpiece - the majestic Arcane Everbloom. The tree's magics have seeped into the surrounding wellspring.
Well I am the Arcane Botanist of Hydrobor, responsible for growing and tending to all flora of magical properties. Behind the gates is my life's work - my Managardens.

option.optiontext: And what can you tell me about these Managardens?
I see. I wanted to ask something else.

node.text: Ah, well the centerpiece behind the gates is an Arcane Everbloom. A very small tree in nature, but over the years I've unlocked its true potential. Powerful magical currents flow through that one, in service of the Academy.

option.optiontext: I see. I wanted to ask something else.

node.text: Past the Arcane Everbloom, several Blueleaf Aspens. They bear the fruit that is every wizard's best friend - Managrapes. Only someone with my set of skills could ever hope to successfully grow these maginificent trees.

option.optiontext: What makes managrapes so special anyways?
I see. I wanted to ask something else.

node.text: The southern section of the gardens is a leisurely park, nothing too exceptional grows there. Though, to my pride, I have managed to attract some faes into it. Faes are very picky about where they choose to live, you know.

option.optiontext: I see. I wanted to ask something else.
Okay, I'll be going now.

node.text: What do you think? Some foods are known to help connect with the realms of magic but nothing quite does it like managrapes. They aid in recovering mana but more importantly they increase a spell's potency.

option.optiontext: I see. I wanted to ask something else.
