Oh wonderful traveler, would you do a young lass a favor? I am to fashion a gift for my betrothed, but have not the materials needed. If you could acquire 4 wolf leather I would pay you a kindly sum of 20 gold per so that I may make a fine tunic with them.

option.optiontext: Sure, I will do that for you.
Sorry, but I am too busy for this.

node.text: Have you gotten the 4 wolf pelts for me yet?

option.optiontext: Working on it!
Here you go!

node.text: Thank you! Here you go, 20 gold per batch of 4 leathers...

option.optiontext: Wait, what?! When you say 'per' it implies 20 gold per leather, not per batch of 4!

node.text: Well, I am not paying that much for the leathers when I could just get them myself. Be lucky I'd even offer you that much as I took pity on you.

option.optiontext: I'll have those back, then. I will not be swindled! You can get your own leathers yourself!
Wretched cunt...

node.text: 'ello there! Help yerself, if yer lookin' to chop some wood. Yer gonna need a hatchet, though.

option.optiontext: What's it like being a lumberjack?
Alright, thanks.

node.text: Prime time to fish, lad! All these fish are a' bitin' today!

option.optiontext: Got a spare rod?
I don't have time to be fishing.

node.text: You there! G'day to you! Do you have a moment to spare?

option.optiontext: Yes, I sure do.
Nope, in a hurry - sorry.

node.text: Outstanding! You see, my relief has been injured, so I have to pull another shift. As I am unable to leave my post, would you be kind enough to go get my dinner from my wife? I won't be home for dinner, and she will probably be worried about me. If you do this, I can spare some coin for you.

option.optiontext: Sure thing!
I am not some petty errand boy, sorry.

node.text: Okay, so my home is next to the armor shop, right next to where the fruit vendor sets up. Tell my wife, Lorice, that I had to pull a double and won't be home at my normal time.

option.optiontext: On it!

node.text: WHO THE HELL ARE YOU?

option.optiontext: Whoa, calm down! Korith sent me!

node.text: Did you ever think to fucking knock first?!

option.optiontext: Oh...umm. Actually, no. Sorry.

node.text: Well, why has my husband sent you here?

option.optiontext: Right. He won't be home tonight, he sa-

node.text: What do you mean he won't be home tonight? He's not coming back?

option.optiontext: ...he said that he-

node.text: HE DID SAY IT? SO HE'S JUST LEAVING ME LIKE THAT, HUH?

option.optiontext: No, he has to pu-

node.text: IT'S THAT VALERIE CUNT, ISN'T IT? THAT WHORE OF A BITCH, I SAW HER EYEBALLING HIM.

option.optiontext: No, he just has to wo-

node.text: THAT BITCH OF A WHORE, I'LL FUCKING KILL HER, I'LL RIP HER WHORISH EYES OUT OF HER SKULL AND EAT THEM, I'LL ST-.

option.optiontext: WILL YOU JUST SHUT THE FUCK UP AND LET ME FINISH?! HE HAS TO PULL ANOTHER SHIFT. THATS IT.

node.text: Oh, why didn't you just say so?

option.optiontext: I tried! You just kept inter-

node.text: Well, you didn't have to raise your voice with me. That was rude. Anyways, is that all?

option.optiontext: He also wanted me to bring him his dinner.

node.text: Oops! I hadn't even started making it yet! Oh no, this isn't good! Here, take this gold to the tavern and find Erissa behind the counter cleaning cups. Tell her I need the 'burnt roast special' for my husband. She'll know what it means. Bring it to my husband, and absolutely DO NOT tell him where you got it from. If you do - I swear, I will hunt you down, murder you, and hang you from your gonads on the old lamp post outside.

option.optiontext: Um...okay? Thanks, and have...a nice day?

node.text: Hello! How can I help ye?

option.optiontext: Erissa, right? I need the burnt roast special - it's for Lorice.

node.text: I got ye. Got caught with Jonathan again, did she? She is always getting herself into something. I swear, without me, Korith would have left her long ago. Anyways, got some fresh ones right out the oven for ye.
About time! I'm starving!

option.optiontext: Here you go.

node.text: Shes a handful, but if there is one thing she does well, its making my favorite dish - tis why I married her, Ill have you know! If she couldn't make this, I don't think I'd have much use for her. Not much for anything else, being lazy and a few potatoes short of a stew, you know?

option.optiontext: Yeah, you must be a real lucky guy.

node.text: Here's your coin - I can't thank you enough for this, stranger. No one should go hungry!

option.optiontext: Thanks, and take care.

node.text: I'm starvin' - go find my wife in my house next to the armor shop - get a move on it before I run ye' through, slow-poke!

option.optiontext: Will do!
Calm down, I've got your food right here!

node.text: That hit the spot, thanks buddy!

option.optiontext: Hey, no problem.

node.text: GET THE FUCK OUTTA MY HOUSE!

option.optiontext: Oops, wrong house.

node.text: Remember, if I find out you said anything, you hang from your gonads. Understood?

option.optiontext: Yes ma'am.

node.text: TAVERN. ERISSA. BURNT ROAST SPECIAL. NOW.

option.optiontext: Yes ma'am.

node.text: Sorry, I'm busy right now.

option.optiontext: Sorry to bother you.

node.text: There's a lass in Haywind town, holds a general store, right behind the gates when ye cross the bridge from 'ere. She's got the best hatchets ye can find in these parts.

option.optiontext: What's it like being a lumberjack?
Alright, thanks.

node.text: Peaceful an' tranquil, ye know? Choppin' trees is my passion; the smell of fresh wood, the sound of a good axe thwacking rhythmically - ain't nothing better I know. Although, in my younger days I used to be an adventurer like you.

option.optiontext: What happened? Don't tell me, you took an arrow to the knee.
Alright, carry on.

node.text: Oh nah, nothing of the sort! Just got too old for it, I guess.

option.optiontext: Ah, makes sense.

node.text: You looking for the inventor too? He's not answering his door, which is unusual because he practically never leaves his workshop.

option.optiontext: I do need to speak with him.
I'm going to check inside.
option.actions: NpcChat=Look inside? Never occurred to me...

option.optiontext: Maybe he'll turn up.

node.text: Yeah, me too, my cartwheel broke again. Don't know what to tell you though, he's not in. Maybe speak to the shopkeeper across the street? Might be a chance he's got what you need.

option.optiontext: Hm, we'll see.

node.text: Welcome to the Old Shrine, traveling soul. The waters of River Aure lap peacefully today, do they not?

option.optiontext: <color=green>*Recover the Lantern of Soothed Souls.*</color>
I bring a lantern designed by the inventor.
<color=green>*Recover the priest's note to Opticus Aluminar.*</color>
I've encountered angry ghosts near a collapsed mine down south...
Tell me again about Greywall?
I take it you're a priest?
Yeah, sure.

node.text: Indeed, I belong to the Order of the Sleeping Souls whose service honors the ones who Dream, though of course our duties also extend to those of us who remain awake.

option.optiontext: Those who dream and those who remain awake, what do you mean?
Tell me about the Order.
What is this place - the old shrine?
I see, goodbye.

node.text: I speak of the Dream, of course. Here in this world we wake and when it is our time to pass, we fall asleep and dream of the things that once were.

option.optiontext: And what role do you presume to play in the afterlife?
There was something else I wanted to talk about.
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Ah, you must be under the impression that the Dream is somehow separate from our world. That it is only for the dead, as our world is only for the living. But it is not so.

Our worlds are intertwined and when the sleeping ones are restless, so may their remains in this world begin to stir. It is thus important to ease a soul's passage to the Dream, to bless them in their slumber. And it is a crime most heinous to disturb them in their sleep.

option.optiontext: So what would you say if a soul was ripped from the Dream and returned to this life? Somehow through the use magic, for example.
There was something else I wanted to talk about.
I see, goodbye.

node.text: That would be an act most foul and abominable! Please, I implore you, do not even speak of such things!

option.optiontext: But could the victim be helped?
There was something else I wanted to talk about.
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Hmph... well... I suppose, such awakened undead should be returned to their place within the Dream, but it is beyond me to speculate how. If they were thus violated through magic, I suspect only magic could mend their condition.
However, magic is very far from the domain of our order. I believe it is a force that was never meant for us humans to meddle with and anyone would do well to steer clear of it.

option.optiontext: I'd like to know more about your order.
I'd like to know more about this place.
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Though our presence here in Imberthale is young, our Order has a long history within the lands of Melloria. We began with a humble monastery in Cleric's Cliff, overlooking the sea, several centuries ago. These days Cleric's Cliff is a bustling city, of course, the halls of the monastery have become many times expanded.

option.optiontext: What does the order do?
There was something else I wanted to talk about.
I see, goodbye.

node.text: We bless both the living and the dead. Some among us have the power to peer into the Dream - the Dreamseers - who may even converse with the souls of our ancestors. They form an important connection with our past, and are thus able to recall memories long lost to time.

Sadly, there are always those in the waking world who would disturb the sleeping ones. Our blessings alone are not always enough to ward against such transgressions, and sometimes the dead begin to stir in their sleep. This why some among us must take upon them the responsibility of becoming the Dreamguard.

option.optiontext: The Dreamguard?
There was something else I wanted to talk about.
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Yes, the warrior caste of our order. Their purpose it is to seek the restless dead and return them to their peaceful slumber. Punishment must also be meted to those who defiled the sleep of the dead in the first place. Death is often the sentence.

option.optiontext: Grim, by whose authority?
There was something else I wanted to talk about.
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Their cause is just, they need no permission. Though perhaps not always everyone agrees, and sometimes tensions have risen. The Dreamguard are not always best liked, but their task is ever so important regardless.

option.optiontext: What did you mean before, when you spoke of those who dream and those who remain awake?
I'd like to know more about this place.
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Curious about the shrine? It was not built by my order, but it has always been here according to the locals. I do not doubt their word - Imberthale is a place for many old things.

Beyond that, I'm afraid I don't know much more about it than you do. But whatever purpose this shrine served in the past, there is a peace to it that I like. It felt natural to take up my duties here.

option.optiontext: What did you mean before, when you spoke of those who dream and those who remain awake?
I'd like to know more about your order.
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Of course, whatever you wish to know?

option.optiontext: What did you mean when you spoke of those who dream and those who remain awake?
I'd like to know more about your order.
I'd like to know more about this place.

node.text: Welcome to my inn! We have warm food, soft beds and the best drinks around!

option.optiontext: I'm looking for an Iris Raven.
Could use a drink, let's see what you've got.
I'm in need of a few coins - know of any jobs around here?
Thanks, see you later.

node.text: Hmm, sure... that man Kurt in the corner's been complaining about rats. There are always rats in cities, but he seems determined to get rid of them, and might be willing to pay coin for it too.

option.optiontext: I'm looking for an Iris Raven.
Could use a drink, let's see what you've got.
All right, see you later.

node.text: Oh, that odd bird? She rented out the attic, but I don't think she did it for the cheap price. Rather seemed like she preferred crawling into a small dark corner to hide in, you know? Just climb up the ladders and you'll find her.

option.optiontext: Could use a drink, let's see what you've got.
I'm in need of a few coins - know of any jobs around here?
Right, thanks.

node.text: It's been refreshing to have a sophisticated conversation for a change, you've earned my respect human. If you ever need a mercenary to fight for you, don't hesitate to call on me.

option.optiontext: Thanks Gar'Mutt, I'll keep that in mind. Be seeing you.

node.text: Hah! Scrawny human approach Ukk'Bukk! Human can fight?

option.optiontext: I've been fighting since before you were born.
I'm not having this conversation.

node.text: Human live long life, troll not. You look weak but say you strong, prove it!

option.optiontext: Prove how?
I don't have to prove anything to you.

node.text: Fight strong troll and win, hah!

option.optiontext: Let's do this.
What will I get if I win?
Maybe another time.

node.text: Hah! Human will dance, will be fun! Human get in mud ring and fight Bugg'Zugg. Bugg'Zugg smash human like bug!
Hah! Hahahaha! Human not win.

option.optiontext: Okay, now we're definitely doing this.
That's it, I'm leaving.

node.text: Bugg'Zugg not smash human? Human smash Bugg'Zugg?!

option.optiontext: Are we done here?

node.text: Brok'Pokk! Human fight Brok'Pokk next! Real test now. Brok'Pokk actual strong warrior.

option.optiontext: All right.

node.text: Puny human dare challenge Brok'Pokk? Get whacked!
Human surprise. Human real challenger. Human will fight strongest trolls.
Gar'Mutt clever troll. Had human pet before. Learned clever things. Maybe you strong, but you clever like Gar'Mutt?

option.optiontext: Let's find out.

node.text: We trolls are stronger than you humans, but your kind usually makes up for it in wit. That won't be happening with me, human.
Human defeat Gar'Mutt... This... Urgh, no word...
*Spits blood.* Unprecedented.
Yes. What Gar'Mutt say. Okay human, you face troll champion - Trum'Buzz. No one beat Trum'Buzz, not even smart Gar'Mutt. Trum'Buzz not smart, but he just so strong. Stronkest.

option.optiontext: Looking forward to it.

node.text: Listen human, you beat Trum'Buzz then you is troll champion. We give you strong trollhammer - Bonecrusher. Only troll champion deserve Bonecrusher. Great honour! Champion also get troll gold. Human understand?

option.optiontext: A weapon and gold? I'll be happy to.

node.text: Okay human, step in mud ring and fight.

option.optiontext: I'm ready.

node.text: I am troll champion. Undefeated.
IM RAVAGING!!!
node.contextBefore: Happens BEFORE this node: for a potential spin move :p

node.text: Trum'Buzz is down, Trum'Buzz is whacked! All hail new troll champion - human!

option.optiontext: *Bow gracefully*
Actually my name is Rothar.

node.text: HAIL HOOOMAN!
Rot? Human is Rot? All hail ROT!
HAIL ROT-HOOOMAN!!!
Okay human, you new troll champion. Here Bonecrusher and gold. Go crush bones!

option.optiontext: Thank you, I will.

node.text: Hail champion! Crush bones.
node.contextBefore: Happens BEFORE this node: quest complete

node.text: Human make my head hurt... Human not weak after all.
I admit you know how to fight, human.

option.optiontext: How come you're smarter than the other trolls?
Right.

node.text: Trum'Buzz is defeated. Human is champion now. Hail champion!

Naturally trolls aren't really as stupid as you humans believe. But our culture values raw physical strength over intelligence. Trolls do not use words to communicate either, unless we came into contact with human civilisation. Our language is physical, words seem strange and unnecessary to most.

option.optiontext: So what, you grew up among humans?

node.text: Not quite, but I served as the personal bodyguard of a Vhosphoran noble for a few decades. It was a lucrative job.

option.optiontext: So what happened?
Good talk, I'm off.

node.text: One day an assassin's arrow found my master's throat. According to the Vhosphoran customs, the personal guard of a noble is to commit suicide upon failing their master. I didn't feel like doing that, so I had to disappear. Came back to my roots, you know?

option.optiontext: I don't blame you. I never had a positive exchange with the Vhosphoran. They see the world too much in black and white and only gravitate to extreme choices.
Makes sense. See you around, Gar'Mutt.

node.text: I am so angry with Strevos! I could stab him in the face! I just want to put a rusty dagger through his tiny eye slits and twist it! I want to...

option.optiontext: Err, is everything okay? You seem pretty upset with this guy.
...walking away...

node.text: He stole an heirloom - a ceremonial sword that has been in my family for generations. It has our family crest engraved on the hilt. He gifted it to his father to be buried with after murdering my brother and claiming it as a trophy! I swear a pox upon his family for centuries to come! Even the children - especially the children! May his wife be barren, and his...

option.optiontext: Have you tried asking for it back? I mean, it has your family crest on it.

node.text: He won't hear any of it, insisting that the sword now belongs in his family since it lies next to his father in the crypt. I'd duel him over it, but alas - I am of no use with a sword.

option.optiontext: What about just going into the crypt and getting it back? Surely anyone who would question it can see the crest and understand that it rightfully belongs in your family, right?

node.text: You are right! Hmm, could I convince an adventurer such as yourself to do this for some coin? I am far too frail to be stumbling around in such a dark and dangerous place.

option.optiontext: I guess I could always use some more coin. How much?

node.text: 150, and the pleasure of helping some poor lass out?

option.optiontext: Fine, I'll see to it then. I will return when I have the sword.
No thanks, grave robbing isn't really my thing.

node.text: Did you delve into the crypt and retrieve my sword yet?

option.optiontext: No, not yet.
Yes, here you go.

node.text: Ahh, alas, I have it! Now, off to find a suitable buyer! Here is your gold. Now, BEGONE!

option.optiontext: Wait, you wanted it just to sell? I thought it was a family heirloom? What about your brother?

node.text: No, sweetie - I just needed to con some poor sap from out of town into grave robbing for me. Take your gold and never speak of it again, and I won't tell the guards I saw the stranger in town wandering around the tombs and looting the valuables from their ancestors. They hate outsiders here - especially ones that loot and rob the graves of their families.

option.optiontext: You are horrible! How can you even...

node.text: Guards! GUARDS!

option.optiontext: SHHH! Fine, I am leaving!

node.text: Begone, peasant!

Right...so, cross the bridge right there. You'll reach a fork right in the road right past the house where Xerxes lives. Hang right and just follow the road right through the forest of odd trees and you'll end up right at the front gate.

option.optiontext: Right. So, bridge, fork, right. Right?

node.text: You wake up stuffed in a cooking pot.

option.optiontext: What the...?

node.text: OOH! We thinked hooman dead. Sorry hooman.

option.optiontext: I'll be going now.

node.text: Human still alive? Want more fight???

option.optiontext: Absolutely, I'm not done here.
Actually, I think I had enough for now.

node.text: Why sir, I assure you all our horses are taken care of up to the highest standard. All stables in these lands fall under the umbrella of Imberthalesian Stable Masters Guild, which enforces strict rules about the care of horses!

Upholding such high standards is hard work for us stablehands, though. Our horses are hungry beasts and it can be hard to find the time to resupply in between grooming and selling rides. Any help with feed deliveries would be greatly appreciated.

option.optiontext: Sure, I might be able to help - what do you need?
I see, well good luck.

node.text: Only the finest nourishment for our horses will do, of course. If you were to bring 10 carrots and 10 barley to any of our stables, I assure you, you will be quite well compensated on behalf of the Stable Masters Guild.

option.optiontext: Any advice where to acquire these foods?
Good to know.

node.text: Oh yes, well... I suppose you could buy them at nearly any of the markets. But you could be more shrewd by searching the fields east of Haywind City, much of the vegetables you'd find in the city are grown there.

option.optiontext: Good to know.

node.text: Oh yes! Our horses are hungry beasts and it can be hard to find the time to resupply in between grooming and selling rides. If you were to bring 10 carrots and 10 barley to any of our stables, I assure you, you will be quite well compensated on behalf of the Stable Masters Guild.

option.optiontext: Any advice where to acquire these foods?

node.text: Oh yes, well... I suppose you could buy them at nearly any of the markets. But you could be more shrewd by searching the fields east of Haywind City, much of the vegetables you'd find in the city are grown there.

option.optiontext: I see.

node.text: Excellent, sir - you've saved me and my horses for another day! You have the deepest thanks of the Stablemasters Guild, which I represent.

I'm, um... not strictly speaking allowed to dole out coin for your troubles. However, I can lend you something even better! I'll send word to my fellow stablehands that you're a friend of the guild and entitled to borrow 'Horsy' at your leisure!

option.optiontext: Erm... Horsy?

node.text: Horsy is our trusty old pack mule! The old boys's used to carrying our earnings safely to the bank for us, evading robbers and the like! You too can store any of your goods in Horsy's bags, and he'll loyally find his way to the bank, or to the stables, depending on where you tell him to go. The bankers know to take your goods in for storage when Horsy shows up.

option.optiontext: Really? Tell me more about how Horsy works.
Right, thanks I guess...

node.text: Horsy's a smart boy - he'll follow you around and respond to your commands. If you're struggling to carry all your goods, you can simply load them up into Horsy's bags! If you tell him, he'll also take your items to the bank for you. Just beware, Horsy's a peaceloving boy, so he might run off if you get into a fight...
<color=#9C8C77>*While Horsy is around, you can give him items and commands by talking to him. You can also store items into Horsy's bags through right-clicking an item you want to store.*</color>

option.optiontext: Right, thanks I guess...
Alright then.

node.text: Certainly, sir!\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*You hear Horsy's excited bray greet you from somewhere behind you.*</color>

option.optiontext: Quick word first; tell me again how Horsy works.

node.text: Rent a horse, sir? It's cheap and will take you to any nearby stables in no time!

option.optiontext: How fare your horses?
Did your horses need feeding?
I bring barley and carrots for your horses.
Sure, I'll rent one.
I'd like to borrow Horsy the pack mule.
Thanks, not now.

node.text: I don't understand, don't think we've ever had earthquakes in this region...

option.optiontext: Can I help you?

node.text: Greetings, stranger. A landslide appears to have blocked the path to the cemetery grounds. No idea what could have caused it, I mean there was some't strange going on at the cemetery but...
Flippin' egg! A man who does not shy away from work! Well, I can't offer much but there's a few coins in it for you once the job is done.

option.optiontext: Yes, let's get started!
Appreciate it. But how do we break down the boulders?

node.text: Hold your horses, you'll need tools to work with. Unfortunately I don't have a spare pickaxe lying around, so unless you got your own, you'll probably need to get one from Timberwell. Tell the young lad by the forge Jonas sent you and he might lend you one.

option.optiontext: As it happens, I'm already carrying a pickaxe.
How do I get to Timberwell?
I should probably head toward the town in that case.

node.text: Aye, and I'll waiting be back here.

Well, you'll need a pickaxe of course. Unfortunately I don't have any spares lying around, so unless you've got your own, you'll probably need to get one from Timberwell. Tell the young lad by the forge Jonas sent you and he might lend you one.

option.optiontext: As it happens, I'm already carrying a pickaxe.
How do I get to Timberwell?
I should probably head towards the town in that case.

node.text: Not from around here, eh? Just follow the road away from here, can't miss it to be honest. It ain't far.

option.optiontext: As it happens, I'm already carrying a pickaxe.
Alright, I'll get going.

node.text: Aye, lad?

option.optiontext: I have my own pickaxe now.
I feel more confident holding my pickaxe now.
So, how do we go about clearing the road again?

node.text: Well for one thing, you'll need a pickaxe of course. Unfortunately I don't have any spares lying around, so unless you've got your own, you'll probably need to get one from Timberwell. Tell the young lad by the forge Jonas sent you and he might lend you one.

option.optiontext: As it happens, I have my own pickaxe already.
And which way do I get to the town?
I see, I should probably head towards Timberwell then.

node.text: Eh? You found that in one of the boulders you mined? Doesn't look like any gem I ever saw... But then strange things did happen here today.
Not from around here, eh? Just follow the road away from here, can't miss it to be honest. It ain't far.

option.optiontext: As it happens, I have my own pickaxe already.
Where can I find myself a pickaxe?
Okay, I'll get going.

node.text: There's a nice young lad with a small forge in Timberwell by the name of Aaron. Tell him Jonas sent you and he should lend you one for free.

option.optiontext: As it happens, I have my own pickaxe now.
Which way is Timberwell again?
Okay, I'll get going.

node.text: Just looking out for yerself, that how it is? Well, I don't have much but there's a few coins in it for you once the job is done.

option.optiontext: All right then. What do I need to get started?
I don't have a use for just 'a few coins', not interested.

node.text: The way is clear again, well done lad! Here's the coin I promised.
node.contextBefore: Happens BEFORE this node: turn in

option.optiontext: Fair enough, I'll get going.
I was hoping for more...
What do you make of this gem? <color=#9C8C77> (show Jonas the gem you found) </color>

node.text: But lad, we're but humble peasants 'round here... I wish I could pay you more, but I ain't got more to give.

option.optiontext: Alright, thanks in any case.

node.text: Well whatever it is, path needs to be cleared. Ain't a task for a lone man though... Say, lad, you up for some honest, hard labor?

option.optiontext: Depends, what's in it for me?
Sorry, can't stop to help right now.

node.text: That's what I like to hear! You ready to get to work?

option.optiontext: Let's do this.
Let's do this.
Wait, I need to take care of something else first.

node.text: Alright, now... Wait, lad, that's no way to hold the pick! Not with large boulders like these anyway, you're just gonna get it stuck or break it. You ever done this kind of work before? <color=red> (Skill check: Mining 5 failed) </color>

option.optiontext: Ahem... Not so much.
I thought it's the right way...

node.text: I reckon it's best you find some smaller rocks to do a few practice swings first. Who knows, might even find a bit of copper if yer lucky.

option.optiontext: I see.

node.text: You'd have to ask someone else, lad. Dunno who though, someone who understands weird things I guess... like a mage or such.

option.optiontext: Fair enough, thanks.
Now, I was hoping for a few more coins...

node.text: I'll hammer it, but it'll cost ya.

option.optiontext: Barnsy Barnsmill sent me, he's in need of help.
I'm here about the problem with Barnsmill.
The good people of Shearston Estate need arms to defend themselves - will you help?
Alright, show me what you can make.
Anything an experienced smith like yourself might teach me?
Anything an experienced smith like yourself might teach me?
Not interested.
<color=green> Recover the Arakite Hammer. </color>

node.text: Ah ye indeed, quite the pickle they're in! Of course I'll help in any way I can, you can count on me! But... it'll cost ya.

option.optiontext: Barnsy Barnsmill sent me, he's in need of help.
I'm here about the problem with Barnsmill.
Forget it.

node.text: Aye, could teach you to make the Haywoods Sickle Sword. Is something every self respecting smith in Imberthale knows to make. There's only one thing... it'll cost ya.\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*Pay 500 coins to learn to craft Haywoods Sickle Sword?*</color>

option.actions: RemoveItems=131-500,UnlockCrafting=669,SetNpcVar=SwordTaught-1,NpcChat=There> I can show you how to make the sword> but you're the one who has to make it.
option.optiontext: Fine. <color=orange>(500 coins)</color>
Forget it.

node.text: Aye, could teach you how to hammer a special sickle sword... but ye don't seem like the type who's properly been taught how to handle metal. Go gather some experience before you come botherin' me about these things!\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*Novice Blacksmith trait required before Forvan agrees to teach you. It may be acquired from Haywind College with Blacksmithing skill level 6.*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Pay 100 gold to recover the Arakite Hammer?*</color>

option.optiontext: No thanks.

node.text: Am hungry! Bring honey?

option.optiontext: Well hello to you too. I'm Rothar.
No, I don't have honey. I should find honey?
Not honey - Rothar. What's your name?
I... no, I don't have honey. Why honey?
No, no honey. Goodbye.

node.text: Am Meepo, bring honey?

option.optiontext: I'm sorry, I don't have any honey. I haven't seen honeybees around here either.
What's the deal with the honey?
No, no honey. Goodbye.

node.text: No bee honey! Faehoney, from Hanifae. You bring?

option.optiontext: Sure, but then how do I get it?
Oh no, I'm not touching Faehoney with a ten foot pole, goodbye.

node.text: Talk to Yohaniii, gives Faehoney. Don't talk to Maihaniii!!!

option.optiontext: Yohaniii, not Maihanii - got it, I'll be back with your honey.
I see. So how do I recognise Yohaniii? Forgive me for saying, but you fae look all the same to me.
Hm, sorry but I'm not your honey courier boy. Get your own honey.

node.text: What?! Fae not all the same at all! Go get honey!

option.optiontext: Right, okay.

node.text: Am hungry!

option.optiontext: I'm so confused... You'll be happy if I bring you honey? Any beehives nearby?
Sorry, you're gonna have to find your own honey.

node.text: Yes! But not bee honey! Faehoney made by Hanifae. Talk to Yohaniii, gives Faehoney. Don't talk to Maihaniii!!!

option.optiontext: Yohaniii, not Maihanii - got it, I'll be back with your honey.
I see. So how do I recognise Yohaniii? Forgive me for saying, but you fae look all the same to me.
I changed my mind. This is way too weird, I don't want to do this.
I'm looking for Yohaniii.
Hmm. You're not the fae I'm looking for.

node.text: Am not Yohaniii!

option.optiontext: Right, but do you know where I can find Yohaniii?
Okay then.

node.text: Stop it! Not Yohaniii!

option.optiontext: I'm looking for Yohaniii.
Hmm. You're not the fae I'm looking for.

node.text: ...want Maihaniii?

option.optiontext: No, no, not Maihaniii! Yohaniii!
So? Can you help?
I'll just go.

node.text: You like haniii?

option.optiontext: Yes, I like honey.

node.text: Yes! Talk to Yohaniii!

option.optiontext: Yes, exactly! Where can I find Yohaniii?
That's the plan.
Don't suppose you could be any more specific?
Thought so.

node.text: Don't talk to Maihaniii!

option.optiontext: Yeah, okay.

node.text: Am Maihaniii!

option.optiontext: Oh? I'm looking for Yohaniii.
Then I'm not supposed to talk to you.

node.text: Not Yohaniii! Maihaniii!

option.optiontext: What's the difference anyway? Can't I get Faehoney from you?
Got it. Not Yohaniii. I'll keep looking.

node.text: NOT YOHANIII !!!

option.optiontext: Come on, just a little bit of honey and I'll be off your hair... or wings, or whatever...
Okay, I take the hint. I'll leave you be.

node.text: AM... NOT... YOHANIIIII !!!

option.optiontext: Uh oh...
Perfect! I can get Faehoney from you?

node.text: *Yohaniii offers you a honeycomb that isn't quite unlike a honeybee's, but it's blue and glittery.*

option.optiontext: Thank you.
Yes, I got your honey... from Yohaniii... Hm, makes sense.
I'm having a hard time finding Yohaniii.
I'll be back later.

node.text: Wat? Why? Yohaniii in village, like all other fae. Go find.

option.optiontext: But there are so many fae around, how do I recognise him?

node.text: Wat? Yohaniii not him, Yohaniii her! Talk to Yohaniii, then you know she Yohaniii. Don't talk to Maihaniii!

option.optiontext: Why not Maihaniii?

node.text: Why? Because she not Yohaniii, that's why!

option.optiontext: Umm... Okay.

node.text: Yes! Thank you! Here, take this.
*Meepo offers you a simple stone with strange markings.*

option.optiontext: Okay, thanks.
Oh? What is it?

node.text: Gift! Take it!

option.optiontext: Umm... Okay thanks, I guess.

node.text: Haniii! Wait... How you get that?

option.optiontext: Umm. Didn't find Yohaniii but I got this honey for you...

node.text: That...? Fae blood on honey...? Said no talking to Maihaniii! Maihaniii dead?! Why?!

option.optiontext: Sorry, but the honey's still good, right?
I have a feeling I should go...

node.text: Don't want your blood honey! Criminal! Murderer! Go! Take filthy blood honey with you!

option.optiontext: Erm, okay. Sorry...

node.text: Criminal! Murderer! Go! Take filthy blood honey with you!
You...!!! Pff...! Kill ten rabbits, but you got five minutes! You give me five coins now, if you succeed I give you fifty, but if you fail I get to keep your coins. That clear enough for you, punk?

option.optiontext: That's all? Easy money. <color=orange> (5 coins) </color>
I don't have to prove anything to you.
Come on, I don't have that many coins on me.

node.text: Hah! Yeah right! Know what I think? I reckon you're just a chicken. Little chicken can't kill defenseless little rabbits, that it? Well go on then, fly away little chicken!
You think you're better than me? You think you're better than me, punk?!

option.optiontext: Yes, I think I'm better than you.
Better how? What are you talking about?

node.text: Loudmouth punk! Kids these days! I've been hun'ing for decades, decades you hear?! No one knows hun'ing like I do! All these kids these days think they can become expert hunters just like that. And what do they do? Come into my forests, drink beer and shoot arrows everywhere! No respect for the hunt!

option.optiontext: I didn't think there was any more to hunting than that.
Mhm, kids these days...
Okay, uncle. I'll leave you to your crazy ramblings.

node.text: Well you're wrong, punk! Hun'ing is about... is about... um... transcending your limitations and um... understanding the deep meaning behind things, you know - the balance of nature!

option.optiontext: That doesn't sound like hunting to me.
Pfff, you're full of shit.

node.text: Well of course it doesn't because you don't know hun'ing like I do! I knew you wouldn't understand! You're just another kid in the woods thinking you know what you're doing! Well I got news for you, buddy: the forest will chew you up and spit you out!

option.optiontext: Never pretended to be a hunter, but I'm willing to bet I'm still better than you are.
Okay, uncle. I'll leave you to your crazy ramblings.

node.text: Oh you done it this time kid! You reaaally had to push it. That's it, I'm challenging you to a hunt-off. Yeah, you heard right! You better learn to put your money where your mouth is! Bet ya fifty coins to your five that you can't kill ten rabbits in under five minutes!

option.optiontext: That's all? Easy money. <color=orange> (5 coins) </color>
That's a lot of numbers.
I don't have to prove anything to you.
Come on, I don't have that many coins on me.

node.text: Hah! Didn't think you'd actually have the balls. Well alright then, get hun'ing!
Oh yeah? Chickening out? Little chicken can't kill defenseless little rabbits, that it? Well go on then, fly away little chicken!

option.optiontext: Right, you're asking for it. <color=orange> (5 coins) </color>

node.text: Talking about hun'ing, of course! What else would I be talking about? All these kids these days think they can become expert hunters just like that. And what do they do? Come into my forests, drink beer and shoot arrows everywhere! No respect for the hunt!

option.optiontext: I didn't think there was any more to hunting than that.
Mhm, kids these days...
Okay, uncle. I'll leave you to your crazy ramblings.

node.text: Oh yeah? Oh yeah?! You think that, do you?! You think I don't know what I'm talking about? That's it, I'm challenging you to a hunt-off! Yeah, that's right punk! Bet ya fifty coins to your five that you can't kill ten rabbits in under five minutes!

option.optiontext: That's all? Easy money. <color=orange> (5 coins) </color>

I don't have to prove anything to you.

option.optiontext: Never pretended to be a hunter, but I'm willing to bet I'm still better than you are.

node.text: Oh look who decided to fly back - it's the little chicken. Well then, did you finally gather all of your chicken courage and decide to accept my hun'ing challenge?

I don't have time for you.

node.text: Hah! Didn't think you'd actually have the balls. Well alright then, get hun'ing!

option.optiontext: Let's go again. <color=orange> (5 coins) </color>

node.text: Well alright! I won't say no to free coins. Ready when you are.
You're in my woods, kid! Show some respect! Only real hunters are allowed in here! You're nothing, kid! Nothing!

node.text: Hah! Hahaha! You're just a kid! Run home to your mammy little kid!

node.text: You done threatening me, punk? You ready to do some real hun'ing?

node.text: Hold on, punk. I didn't like the way you talked to me before so you'll have to bet more now. Say, 10 coins.

node.text: Well alright then. Go on, git on them rabbits!

node.text: 'course, rabbits ain't that much of a challenge now are they? Don't get me wrong, kids these days can't use a bow to hit a tree trunk, much less a rabbit. But rabbits are prey - real hun'ers hunt predators! How 'bout another challenge?

node.text: Well I'll be... There's a lot more hun'er in you than I expected, punk. Ain't a shame to give someone like you my trusty old knife, you've earned it.

option.optiontext: Name it.
Maybe later.

node.text: Right on, punk hun'er! It's them bears - toughest opponents in these woods. Fell 5 of them in the same time as before an' I'll give you my very own hun'ing bow. Is a real bow worthy only of real hun'ers. But this time I want you to bet 50 coins.

option.optiontext: Get ready to give up your bow then. <color=orange> (50 coins) </color>
I think I need to prepare.

node.text: Well alright, you go on now and prove to me if you're a real hun'er after all.
Back again, hun'er? Ready for the final challenge worthy only of real hun'ers?
Couldn't do it, eh? Ain't no shame in it, ain't no shame in it at all. Bears are tough as... you know... bears. Willing to go for another run?

option.optiontext: I can do this. <color=orange> (50 coins) </color>
I think I need to prepare myself.

node.text: Hello, sir! Want to see a magic trick?

option.optiontext: Why aren't you playing with the other kids?
Not right now, thanks.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77> *The boy shows you his empty tophat, then pulls a carrot out of it.* </color>\n\n Tadaa!

option.optiontext: Hm, how about I teach you some real magic, boy?
Umm... wow, well done kid! Keep practicing!
Wait, aren't you supposed to pull a bunny out of it?

node.text: The other kids are stupid! They only want to play knights - so boring! I told them I want to be a wizard, but they said they don't play with dumb wizards. Magic is way cooler than knights if you ask me.

option.optiontext: That's right! Show me a magic trick?
Don't be a wizard, kid. I hate wizards.
Okay. Well, good luck kid!

node.text: Thanks! One day I'll be just like one of those Hydrobor wizards!

option.optiontext: Good luck with that.

node.text: No, you're stupid! Go away!
You'd do that? Oh please sir, show me!
<color=#9C8C77> *You teach the boy how to summon a small flame.* </color>
Wooooow! That's so cool! Now I'm way cooler than the other kids! Thanks, sir!

option.optiontext: Now remember, kid: with great power comes great responsibility.
That's right, boy. Go set the world on fire.

node.text: Yes, sir! I'll remember that, sir! \n\n <color=#9C8C77> *Your actions have rewarded you with an orb of responsibility.* </color>

option.optiontext: Good luck, kiddo.

node.text: Hahaa! No one will dare call me a dumb wizard anymore! I'll make sure of it. \n\n <color=#9C8C77> *Your actions have rewarded you with an orb of recklessness.* </color>

option.optiontext: Good luck, kiddo.

node.text: Leave me alone!

option.optiontext: I'm sorry kid, I didn't mean what I said. Come on then, show me a magic trick?

node.text: <color=#9C8C77> *The boy is reluctant at first, but he then shows you his empty tophat, then pulls a carrot out of it.* </color>\n\n Tadaa!

option.optiontext: Hm, how about I teach you some real magic, boy?
Umm... wow, well done kid, keep practicing!
Wait, aren't you supposed to pull a bunny out of it?

node.text: I... well... I had a bunny before, but during one performance he... umm... died.

option.optiontext: Hm, how about I teach you some real magic, boy?

node.text: Another trick, sir?

option.optiontext: Why aren't you playing with the other kids?
Not right now, thanks.

node.text: The Great Rabbit will devour us all.

option.optiontext: Excuse me?
Yeah, okay.

node.text: People have forsaken the old truths! But I still remember! Wizards appear, and we no longer have to pay sacrifice to the Great Rabbit? Wizards appear, and the Great Rabbit's wrath must no longer be appeased? No, traveler. The Great Rabbit waits. The Great Rabbit hungers.

option.optiontext: Keep away from the booze, old man.
Anyone ever tell you you're crazy?
Okay, goodbye.

node.text: Many times, traveler. Many times. All you sheep laugh at me, call me crazy. Doesn't mean I'm wrong.

option.optiontext: Yeah, well maybe try keeping away from the booze and who knows - rabbits might stop bothering you.
Okay then, goodbye.

node.text: Very funny. You all laugh. The Great Rabbit will wipe away your smiles.

option.optiontext: Okay then, goodbye.

node.text: Fancy some beautiful, homegrown vegetables, sir?

option.optiontext: I do.
Nice day, isn't it?
Not right now, thanks.

node.text: We prefer to say 'innit' around these parts, sir, but it sure is. Now, can I interest you in some vegetables?

option.optiontext: Okay, I'll buy your vegetables.
Not right now, thanks.

node.text: Fresh meats, sir?

option.optiontext: Ever considered that it's possible to only eat vegetables?
No thanks.

node.text: Oh my... Please, just go.

option.optiontext: Calm down, I'd still like to buy your meats.

node.text: Hi, sir! If you're into hunting, you've come to the right place; I have several top quality bows available right now!

option.optiontext: Sure, I'll have a look.
You like hunting, eh?
Sorry, not interested.

node.text: I've hunted with my brother for as long as I remember, but he was always the better shot - I rather make the bows. Pop by the tailor's shop and talk to him if you're interested in leather. Just don't expect much conversation, he can be a bit rough around the edges.

option.optiontext: I'd like to have a look at those bows you're selling.
Alright, have a nice day.

node.text: What do you want?! You look too scrawny to even lift a battleaxe, hah! Go home and eat a steak.

option.optiontext: Excuse me? Is this the way you greet all your customers?
<color=#9C8C77> *Knock him over.* </color>

node.text: I only deal with real warriors, not scrubs like you! I have standards to uphold!

option.optiontext: Fancy yourself a real warrior, eh? There isn't a dent on your armor.
<color=#9C8C77> *Knock him over.* </color>
Fine. Whatever.

node.text: Wha...? Well, erm... it's obviously because no one ever dares challenge me to a fight. Anyone can see I'm not someone to be trifled with!

option.optiontext: Really? I wouldn't think twice about taking you.
<color=#9C8C77> *Knock him over.* </color>
Of course. Goodbye.

node.text: Err...? Hah! Haha! Good joke.

option.optiontext: Seriously, are you going to sell me a weapon, or do I need to kick your teeth in first?
<color=#9C8C77> *Knock him over.* </color>

node.text: Ahem... Perhaps I was wrong about you - you are clearly a great warrior. By all means, browse my weapons and let me know if there's anything suitable to your needs.
BY THE LIGHT OF HEAVENS, PLEASE DON'T HURT ME! OH LIGHT, PLEASE!

option.optiontext: You're a tough little warrior, aren't you? Very fearsome in that shiny plate armor.

node.text: Oh heavens! *sob* I've never been in a fight in my whole life! Please don't tell anyone, I can't afford to lose my reputation! Please, I promise you'll have a discount on all my wares.

option.optiontext: That seems reasonable. Let's see what you have.
I like the sound of that. I'll be back later.

node.text: Ah it is you again, the great warrior. May I indulge you with the finest weaponry Haywind has to offer?

option.optiontext: Let's see what you've got.
Not right now.

node.text: Oh gracious master, if any of the weapons might please your eye, please don't hesitate to ask. I will offer you my best price!

option.optiontext: Let's see what you've got.
Oh pull yourself together and stop being such a sad little weasel of a man, would you?!
Not right now.

node.text: Oh heavens! Yes, I'm a sad little weasel! <color=#9C8C77>*sob*</color> I'm so sorry! <color=#9C8C77>*sob*</color> Please, just don't hurt me!

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*sigh*</color>, Show me your weapons then.

node.text: Greetings and welcome to my humble boutique, esteemed gentleman-customer. You are looking for armor both fashionable and impenetrable, yes? Then I am the gentleman you are looking for.

option.optiontext: Great, I'd like to browse your wares.
Thanks, another time.

node.text: The gentleman is sure he would not first prefer that I take his measurements? One often finds that it is imperative for armor to be well adjusted to offer the necessary protections.

option.optiontext: Thank you, that won't be necessary, just here to browse.
Measurements? Sure, why not.
Actually, I might come back later.

node.text: I see, well if the gentleman is quite sure...?

option.optiontext: The gentleman is sure, yes.
Oh fine, let's see about the measurements then.

node.text: Perfect! The gentleman will be quite pleased, I'm sure. Now if the gentleman would stand just here... facing this way... just so...
Next, the gentleman should turn exactly 90 degrees this way... and if the gentleman would be so kind as to keep his jaw straight...

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Be patient.*</color>
Enough with these measurements!

node.text: Next, if the gentleman might stand perfectly immobile... without even a breath... which the gentleman conveniently appears to be holding already, very good...

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Be patient.*</color>
Enough with these measurements!

node.text: Ah, here the gentleman seems surprisingly... bony... which of course is not to say the gentleman does not have an admirable form, not at all... Yet, here the gentleman is missing a bone?? But of course, it is not an obstacle...

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Be patient.*</color>
Enough with these measurements!

node.text: Next here... and here... The gentleman has lost a few of his fingers? This is a tragedy to be sure, but of course the gentleman bears it well... Only the feet more, if the gentleman would be so patient...

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Be patient.*</color>
Enough with these measurements!

node.text: And there, all done. I now have the gentleman's exact measurements, which allow for adjusting the esteemed gentleman's armor to perfection. Next, might I invite the gentleman to consider options for protective coating?\n\n<color=#9C8C77> *You have received a trait that increases your defenses.* </color>

option.optiontext: Yes please, finally.
I'll check in later, thank you.

node.text: Ah, of course. The gentleman is not one for patience, alas the perfect measurements do require it. Would the gentleman at least like to see options for protective coating?

option.optiontext: Yes please, finally.
I'll check in later, thank you.

node.text: The esteemed gentleman returns, would he per chance be interested in obtaining an armor most fashionable and impenetrable?

option.optiontext: Yes, please.
Not today.

node.text: You wish to mock me further? Go on then, I don't care. You will be but a snack when the Great Rabbit comes to feast.

option.optiontext: Tell me about this Great Rabbit then.
Living in a mess like this, I can't help but wonder if breathing all the mold may have infected your brain.

node.text: No, I shall not! The Great Rabbit's secrets shall not fall on the ears of a sheep!

option.optiontext: Living in a mess like this, I can't help but wonder if breathing all the mold may have infected your brain.
Whatever, crazy man.

node.text: Very funny. You're a funny man, aren't you? You won't be laughing when the Great Rabbit comes.

option.optiontext: Yeah, okay.

node.text: Yes, what? What do you want?

option.optiontext: M'ster Robert Riley?

node.text: Yes I am. So what?

option.optiontext: You owe the banker a debt - I'm here to collect.

node.text: Hah! That dumb boy Burt was here earlier and I can tell you he left empty handed, so good luck with that!

option.optiontext: How about I start by asking nicely? Please, pay up.
Do you think my luck might be helped by threatening to break your legs?

node.text: Hah! Nice try! Tell you what, I have all my gold hidden away in case of bandits like you. So sure you can collect, but you need to find the gold first. Hah! Haha!

option.optiontext: Let's cut the games to where you tell me where to find it.
Okay, that will probably be quicker than trying to talk to you anyway.

node.text: I'm not telling you anything! And you can't make me!

option.optiontext: *sigh*, whatever.

node.text: Hah! Nice try! See, I've hidden away all my gold and I'd rather die than tell you where to find it!

option.optiontext: You'd rather die than pay the banker his due? Are you serious?
We'll see about that.

node.text: It's a matter of principles! It's about standing up to my rights! I won't be pushed around! Yeah, that's right!

option.optiontext: Oh well, I doubt your stash will be hard to find.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77> *You find a large coin stash* </color>\nHey! You weren't supposed to find that! You can't do this!

option.optiontext: Watch me.

node.text: Bah! This is a legal robbery! You're a thief, you know that?!

option.optiontext: Get out of my way.

node.text: Hey! You weren't supposed to find that! What are you doing?! You can't take all of it, I don't even owe the banker anywhere near that much!!

option.optiontext: It's for the inconvenience you've caused me.

node.text: I can't let you take that! You'll ruin me!!

option.optiontext: What are you going to do about it?

node.text: Yes, what is it? I'll have you know, I'm a busy man.

option.optiontext: You're master Gilbert Sletnes?
Then I'll leave you in peace.

node.text: Yes, get to the point already!

option.optiontext: Your payments to the banker are late - I'm here to collect.

node.text: Well I don't have it, so you can go now.

option.optiontext: What do you mean, you don't have it?
I tend to solve problems with violence. Do we have a problem, master Sletnes?

node.text: I... DON'T... HAVE... THE MONEY. There, was that clear enough for you? So how am I supposed to pay?

option.optiontext: If that's the case, I'm forced to confiscate some of your property.

node.text: Wha... WHAT? No! That's not fair! I'll... I'll complain to the mayor about this!

option.optiontext: I'm sorry, but that's the way these things go.
I really don't care.

node.text: WHAT?! No! No you can't hurt me, there are still laws around here! How would that help with my debt anyway, unless master Thurlow wants me to repay him with my blood?

option.optiontext: Oh well, if you literally can't pay, I suppose I'll have to confiscate some of your property as payment.

node.text: Welcome, traveling soul.

option.optiontext: You're a local priest?

node.text: I am no priest yet, but an initiate of the Sleeping Souls. I tend to my duties here at the old cemetery, the priest you will find at the Ancient Shrine north of town.

option.optiontext: What's the Sleeping Souls?
The old cemetery? The new one is east of Haywind, right?
I need to go, goodbye.

node.text: We are an order of servants to the Dream here in the Waking World. If you seek out the priest in the northern shrine, he is much better suited to tell you more.

option.optiontext: The Dream and the Waking World?
So this is the old cemetery? The new one is east of Haywind, right?
I need to go, goodbye.

node.text: Yes, but surely you are aware? Here in this world we wake, until eventually we are to fall asleep again and enter the Dream.

option.optiontext: You mentioned this is the old cemetery? The new one is east of Haywind, right?
Umm, right. Anyway, I should go.

node.text: Yes, since the town grew around the old one, a new cemetery needed to be established. Haywind's oldest souls are buried here. For now their voices remain silent to my ears, but one day I wish to hear them.

option.optiontext: You wish to talk to the dead?
You said you belong to the Sleeping Souls, who are they?
I need to go, goodbye.

node.text: It is not so crude as you put it, but the Seers of our order may achieve visions of the Dream. I aspire to one day see through the eyes of a Seer.

option.optiontext: The Dream. You speak of the afterlife?
Umm, right. Anyway, I should go.

node.text: Yes, but surely you are aware? Here in this world we wake, until eventually we are to fall asleep again and enter the Dream.

option.optiontext: You mentioned you belong to the Sleeping Souls, who are they?
Umm, right. Anyway, I should go.
Hello. Who might you be?

node.text: My name's Birna and I'm a weatherwitch here on behalf of the Hydrobor Academy to provide the lovely farmers of Haywind with a favourable weather. Isn't that so exciting?

option.optiontext: Yes, very exciting. What's the Hydrobor Academy?
Wait, is that why it's so sunny and warm here? You're controlling the weather?
Not really, goodbye.

node.text: Oh yeah, totally! Before the magi of Hydrobor settled here, Haywind was pretty cold and damp, you know - like all the rest of Imberthale. Like, why even try farming this far north, am I right?
Anyway, some of us happen to have natural talents for manipulating the weather, so now the good people of Haywind can enjoy fantastic harvests!

option.optiontext: Fantastic. Tell me more about this Hydrobor Academy.
Fantastic. Goodbye.

node.text: It's an academy for extremely talented wizards and witches, of course! They fled here from the southern lands of Vhosphor because something nasty was going on, but I don't actually know that much about it. I was born here after all that happened, you see.

option.optiontext: So what does a weatherwitch do? Control the weather?
All right, take care.

node.text: Hi again!

option.optiontext: Hello, who are you again?

node.text: Oi, you! You're the creep that threatened my delicate little sister! I'm gonna teach you a lesson on what happens to creeps like you!

option.optiontext: Oh, brilliant...

node.text: Ah yes, Gilbert. He lives in the smaller house of the market plateau, north-western Haywind. Jealous of his neighbor's home, he took out a loan to renovate, but the renovations never took place. The man is known to gamble and I suspect that's where the money went. But one way or another, he needs to pay back.

option.optiontext: What about Matilda Cornish?
What about Robert Riley?
What about Beatrice Brier?
Alright, you'll have your gold soon enough.

node.text: Matilda Cornish moved to the town from a little corn farm, bless her soul. She has a decent repute, but for some odd reason she turned indignant when I sent Burt to collect payment. See if you'll have better luck? She lives in her small home on the hill right next to the bank.

option.optiontext: What about Gilbert Sletnes?
What about Robert Riley?
What about Beatrice Brier?
Alright, you'll have your gold soon enough.

node.text: Ugh, Robert Riley. I should known better than to lend money to that redneck, but at least it was a relatively small sum. He's under the impression he can avoid repayment, but you'll prove him wrong, won't you? His home is opposite the inn south of here.

option.optiontext: What about Gilbert Sletnes?
What about Matilda Cornish?
What about Beatrice Brier?
Alright, you'll have your gold soon enough.

node.text: Young Beatrice was so grateful when I lent her a small sum to spend on a fancy dress, yet now that she's supposed to pay me back, she believes she's being treated unfairly. The Brier family home is one of the buildings opposite the inn, southern part of town.

option.optiontext: What about Gilbert Sletnes?
What about Matilda Cornish?
What about Robert Riley?
Alright, you'll have your gold soon enough.

node.text: Very well. Now, was there something else?

option.optiontext: Can you tell me more about these people who owe you?
Gilbert no longer owes you.
Matilda no longer owes you.
Robert no longer owes you.
Beatrice no longer owes you.
Nothing right now. I'll talk to you later.

node.text: Ah yes, Gilbert. He lives in the smaller house of the market plateau, north-western Haywind. Jealous of his neighbor's home, he took out a loan to renovate, but the renovations never took place. The man is known to gamble and I suspect that's where the money went. But one way or another, he needs to pay back.

option.optiontext: What about Matilda Cornish?
What about Robert Riley?
What about Beatrice Brier?
Alright, that's all I need to know.

node.text: Matilda Cornish moved to the town from a corn farm, bless her soul. She has a decent repute, but for some odd reason she turned indignant when I sent Burt to collect payment. See if you'll have better luck? She lives in her small home on the hill right next to the bank.

option.optiontext: What about Gilbert Sletnes?
What about Robert Riley?
What about Beatrice Brier?
Alright, that's all I need to know.

node.text: Ugh, Robert Riley. I should known better than to lend money to that redneck, but at least it was a relatively small sum. He's under the impression he can avoid repayment, but you'll prove him wrong, won't you? His home is opposite the inn south of here.

option.optiontext: What about Gilbert Sletnes?
What about Matilda Cornish?
What about Beatrice Brier?
Alright, that's all I need to know.

node.text: Young Beatrice was so grateful when I lent her a small sum to spend on a fancy dress, yet now that she's supposed to pay me back, she believes she's being treated unfairly. The Brier family home is one of the buildings opposite the inn, southern part of town.

option.optiontext: What about Gilbert Sletnes?
What about Matilda Cornish?
What about Robert Riley?
Alright, that's all I need to know.

node.text: Welcome to our humble shop, traveler! I can help you with fabrics and you can talk to my husband for all things leather related. Though try not to mind, he can be a little curt, but he means no disrespect.

option.optiontext: Thanks, I'd like to see your wares.
I'd like to try my hand at sewing something myself, mind if I use the workbench?
Thanks, I'm just browsing.

node.text: Oh not at all! We're a very open and helpful lot here in Haywind, you know. And if you're missing any materials, I might have some extra in stock.

option.optiontext: Actually, I'd like to see your wares.
Thanks, I'll keep that in mind.

node.text: Weapons up, boys! Wait... this 'un doesn't look hostile...

option.optiontext: What are you lads doing down here?
That's right, I'm not. I'm just looking to pass through the crypts.

node.text: Who, what, us? We're totally honest, innocent laborers, toiling down here in the crypts! T'was all peace and quiet until all of a sudden dead things started to get a little lively.

Now, I told my boys not to touch anything they shouldn't, so I dunno how this happened! But we managed to lift the drawbridge there an' cut the undead off, so I guess now we just wait for things to quiten down, innit?

option.optiontext: I'd count robbing graves as touching things you shouldn't.
I'm not going to sit here, I need to get past that bridge.

node.text: Ah, we got one of them high and mighty ones with us, boys. I'd choose my words a little more carefully as I were you, but no offense taken on our part yet, right boys? So you try to keep it that way now, or we might get a bit violent.

option.optiontext: Look, I don't care. I just need to get past that bridge.
I don't appreciate your tone.

node.text: Why, you mad or sumthin'? Well we prefer staying here an' the way we fixed it, you'll need to shoot that rope with a bow to get the bridge down. We sure as shit ain't giving you one.

option.optiontext: That's fine, I'm already carrying a bow.
But you do have bows...
Whatever, I can find a bow.

node.text: Shait... Then you also better use it on the undead on the other side, 'cause if they come harassin' us, I'll hunt you down an' give you a beatin', alright?

option.optiontext: So... what's in that chest behind you?
Whatever you say.

node.text: Oh you are one flippin' joker... Listen, you show up anywhere near that chest and we ain't gonna be gentle with you, understand? Now piss off!

option.optiontext: The way I see it, you're lowlife thugs. I don't have a problem cutting you down and taking your stuff.

node.text: That how it is? Try sayin' that again with your head chopped off, eh?
Like I said, we ain't helping you get that bridge down, understand?! Make your own damn bow if you're so intent on gettin' yourself killed, but leave us out of it.

option.optiontext: The way I see it, you're lowlife thugs. I don't have a problem cutting you down and taking your stuff.
Huh, maybe I will.

node.text: Oh nah, that's not a good idea. We were on the other side erm... doin' our honest work when all of a sudden all the dead things started to get a little lively.

Now, I told my boys not to touch anything they shouldn't, so I dunno how this happened! But we managed to lift the drawbridge there an' cut the undead off, so I guess now we just wait for things to quiten down, innit?

option.optiontext: I'd count robbing graves as touching things you shouldn't.
No, I'm not going to sit here and wait. I need to go through.

node.text: Back again, eh? What do you want?

option.optiontext: I'm curious, what's in that chest behind you?

node.text: Wait, what... we killed you, I swear we did...?!?!

option.optiontext: It seems I'm not that easy to kill nowadays.

node.text: By the holy mother of all that's living... cut it down boys! Cut the monster down!
Oi! What you think you're doing back there?!

option.optiontext: I'm curious, what's in that chest behind you?

node.text: That's right - piss off!
You gone and done it then! I gotta say, punk, you ain't no punk after all - you're a true hun'er! There ain't too many of us around these days. And my hun'ing bow - you've earned it.

option.optiontext: Sure, I'll take it.
You're not angry that you lost it?

node.text: You keep your eyes open now, never know what fantastic beasts you can find out there. Keep on hun'ing!
Like I said, you earned it. That is the way of a true hun'er. Besides, it's about time I made myself a new bow, a truly legendary bow to match what a legendary hun'er I've become.

option.optiontext: Umm... Okay, good luck with that.

node.text: Greetings, stranger! Come here looking for our famous Mistywood Dew whiskey?

option.optiontext: Yes, I'm in need of a bottle.

node.text: Best you talk to Master Barnsmill down in the basement then. We've, er... had something of a hiccup in production recently.

option.optiontext: This farm looks bigger than most around here.
Master Barnsmill?

node.text: Aye, we brew the infamous Mistywood Dew here. Stuff tastes something sordid if you ask me, but demand's never been better. Who am I to judge?

option.optiontext: Who's Master Barnsmill?

node.text: Aye, Barnsy Barnsmill. He owns the estate, continued the long line of whiskey makers in his family here in Haywind. He's the one you'll be wanting to talk to about that whiskey.

option.optiontext: This farm looks bigger than most around here.

node.text: Nu'uh, you can't move the Champion to that square when it's being shielded by the Wizard!
That's a stupid rule! It's not even a rule, you made it up!
No I didn't!! Everybody knows about shielding, you just don't understand how the game works! It's not that hard, honestly.
That's it! I won't play anymore!
Come on, don't quit! Nobody likes a quitter. Let's just play.

option.optiontext: Hello little girls.
Where are your parents?
What are you playing?

node.text: Hello, sir.
Hi, sir.

option.optiontext: Where are your parents?
What are you girls playing?

node.text: Mama's in town, working at her stupid inn. Like, who in their right mind would want to run an inn?
She's there ALLL the time, ugh...
And Papa's down in the basement fiddling with his stupid whiskey machine, which I guess is broken or something.

option.optiontext: Well, what are you girls playing?
I see, carry on.

node.text: You need to ask? Are you like old or something? It's the Drassen Siege!
Yeah, it's super popular! The only people who don't yet know about it are old grandpas.

option.optiontext: Drassen? As in Drassen'Vhos, of the Vhosphoran Kingdom?
And where are your parents?

node.text: Ummm... I literally have no idea what you just said. Fos...for... Kingdom, is it that far away desert place? Yeah, I don't really care about that.

option.optiontext: And where are your parents?
Yeah, okay.

node.text: Wait, no you can't do that! You said before that the Priest can sacrifice himself to shield the Champion from harmful spells!
No I didn't.
Yes you did! You're lying!
No I didn't!!

option.optiontext: Hello little girls.
Where are your parents?
What are you playing?

node.text: Hah! I win, again!
This isn't fair...
Come on, you just need to learn more about the game. Let's play again.

option.optiontext: Hello little girls.
Where are your parents?
What are you playing?

node.text: If you do that... then my champion moves here to attack your Mage King!
Wait, umm... no, you can't do that...
Oh yeah? No more Wizards left protecting your squares, so what are you gonna do?
Wait... so... I need to think...

option.optiontext: Hello little girls.
Where are your parents?
What are you playing?

node.text: I hear the whiskey distiller is running again, thanks to you. You have our deepest graditude, traveler.

option.optiontext: Who are you again?
Tell me about this place.

node.text: You may simply call me Heron. I am the hired hand to the Barnsmill Estate.

option.optiontext: Tell me about this place.

node.text: The highly prestigious Mistywood Dew whiskey is produced here, of course. It has been a generational project for the Barnsmill family, ever since Barnsy II began producing over a hundred years ago now.

option.optiontext: Who are you again?

node.text: Hello to you, traveler! Come to admire my swords?

option.optiontext: These flashy swords belong to you?
No, I don't care about swords.

node.text: Indeed they do. One could say I'm something of a sword enthusiast and a collector, traveling the world in search of new rarities to add to my collection.

option.optiontext: Can you tell me more about the swords on display?
Where did you travel from?
Okay, good luck.

node.text: On the left I have a fine Vhosphoran Tigri, in the middle a sword from the Phalean Wildfolk and finally on the right, an authentic Dreamguard's Arming Sword.

option.optiontext: What's a Vhosphoran Tigri?
Sword of the Phalean Wildfolk?
A Dreamguard's Arming Sword?
Can I buy one?
Where did you travel from?
That's nice. Goodbye.

node.text: I arrived here from the city of Traire, but originally I hail from the Arnean Plains further south-west. I've been on the road for a while now, but this is as far north as I ever came.

option.optiontext: Can you tell me more about the swords on display?
That's nice. Goodbye.

node.text: Oh, traveler before you go; if you happen to come across a particularly rare sword in your travels, I might want to buy it from you. I have a feeling these lands hold great untapped potential for a collector like myself.

option.optiontext: I'll keep that in mind.

node.text: Hah! Hahaha! No.

option.optiontext: Tell me about the Vhosphoran Tigri?
Tell me about the Sword of the Phalean Wildfolk?
Tell me about the Dreamguard's Arming Sword?
Where did you travel from?

node.text: A rather special scimitar employed only by the Vhosphoran Royal Guard. I assure you, it was quite tricky to get my hands on it as an outsider.

option.optiontext: What about the Sword of the Phalean Wildfolk?
What about the Dreamguard's Arming Sword?
Can I buy it?
Where did you travel from?
That's nice. Goodbye.

node.text: Ah yes, the wildfolk of the Phalean woodlands. Peculiar people, male druids protected by female warriors, and those who do not make the cut to be one or the other become laborers. This sword would have belonged to one of their warrior women.

option.optiontext: What about the Vhosphoran Tigri?
What about the Dreamguard's Arming Sword?
Can I buy it?
Where did you travel from?
That's nice. Goodbye.

node.text: Yes, the militant wing of the priestly Order of the Sleeping Souls. I don't really understand them, but I suppose they hunt undead creatures and the sort. Return ''restless souls back to sleep'' or some such nonsense. They don't exactly give out their swords to outsiders either, so it's a rarity.

option.optiontext: What about the Vhosphoran Tigri?
What about the Sword of the Phalean Wildfolk?
Can I buy it?
Where did you travel from?
That's nice. Goodbye.

node.text: Welcome to Haywind's Townhall! I'm Ava, the mayor's wife.

option.optiontext: My pleasure! My name is Rothar - Rothar Aercrest.
Where might I find the mayor?
Thank you, goodbye.

node.text: How delightful! And what brings you here, master Aercrest?

option.optiontext: Could I speak with the mayor?
Nothing in particular.

node.text: Of course! My husband is upstairs at the moment, keeping council with... that man...

option.optiontext: ...that man?
Splendid, goodbye.

node.text: My apologies, I meant Azzar Kheyn of course. My husband regards him as a trusted advisor.

option.optiontext: What do you regard him as?
He has an exotic name.
I see, goodbye.

node.text: I... ahem... I don't think he's a good influence. Sometimes I've caught him staring at me in a way that makes me shiver, but my husband will hear none of it, so it may be best I don't speak too much of it.

option.optiontext: He has an exotic name, doesn't he?
I see, goodbye.

node.text: He's an influential Vhosphoran merchant, according to his own words.

option.optiontext: What do you think of him?
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Welcome back, master Aercrest! How may I help you?

option.optiontext: Wanted to see the mayor.
Nothing right now, thank you.

node.text: Greetings, weary traveler. What seek you from the Master Alchemist Xerxes Alexxander Xalaxar himself?

option.optiontext: So you brew potions?
That's a rather difficult name to pronounce. You wouldn't have a nickname, would you?
Don't often see someone with such dark complexion this far north.
Nothing, nevermind.

node.text: Difficult for you, perhaps. But I like my name, I shall not be called any other.

option.optiontext: So you brew potions then?
You have quite an exotic name and complexion to be this far north.
Fair enough. Goodbye, Xerx...sus. Ahem.

node.text: That is a crass way of putting it - what I do is art - but yes, there isn't a potion in the world that I could not make.

option.optiontext: Do you have anything special to sell?
You have a rather difficult name to pronounce. Wouldn't have a nickname, would you?
Don't often see someone with such dark complexion this far north.
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Do not mistake me for some common peddler. If there is something specific you seek, name it, and I might help you. But beware, the price will also be special.

option.optiontext: You have a rather difficult name to pronounce. Wouldn't have a nickname, would you?
Don't often see someone with such dark complexion this far north.
I don't happen to need anything right now, goodbye.

node.text: Yes, I am dark, where you are very pale. It is because I hail from the Dunes of Bairuun. It is far away south, very far. But I like it here.

option.optiontext: What made you come?
So you brew potions then?
How interesting, goodbye.

node.text: Long time ago a young Xerxes decides he is alchemist. But dunes at home do not offer much variety in plants, not much variety at all. So young Xerxes leaves and travels the world - studies it.
Finally, he makes it here, where he has literally a magical forest by his doorstep. He decides to stay.

option.optiontext: A magical forest, you say?
So you brew potions then?
You have a rather difficult name to pronounce. Wouldn't have a nickname, would you?
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Why yes, of course. To the west, what locals here call the Oldroot Forest. Perhaps they too know it is very old indeed. I suspect the Qaeshtar made it, but that is only speculating.

option.optiontext: The Qaeshtar?
So you brew potions then?
You have a rather difficult name to pronounce. Wouldn't have a nickname, would you?
How interesting, goodbye.

node.text: What many call the Ancients. But who would know now? And it matters not in any case. The forest was here long before us and will continue to be long after we are gone.

option.optiontext: So you brew potions then?
You have a rather difficult name to pronounce. Wouldn't have a nickname, would you?
How interesting, goodbye.

node.text: Oh, it's terrible! Have you heard? Thornhill was hit by a plague! My poor brother, Finnian, lives there and I've not heard back from him. I hope he's okay...

option.optiontext: Thornhill? Plague?

node.text: Yes! Can you imagine? Imberthale's oldest, largest city and the seat of the Lord-Mayor himself, reeling from a deadly plague! And my dear brother, what of him...?

option.optiontext: I see. Good luck.
Hello, what are you doing here?
Hello child. What's this board?

node.text: My dad is one of Haywind's artisans. They need lots and lots and lots of stuff to make other, cooler stuff, so he sent me here to let people know about their material orders.

option.optiontext: Um, so what's this board?

node.text: It contains all the material requests our very own Haywind artisans need. If you have a lot of useful stuff stored up in your bank, maybe you can sell it to them!

option.optiontext: What kind of 'stuff' do they need?
I see.

node.text: Ugh, I don't know! I'm just a child you know. Check the board!

I don't claim to be a master smith or anything, but I do have a few dusty smithing books I could sell. It's all pretty straightforward though; I look for ore at the cliffsides and smelt the metal into ingots, which I then hammer into horseshoes at the anvil. Well I guess you could shape metal into anything, but mostly we just need horseshoes around here.

option.optiontext: A man named Jonas told me I might get a pickaxe from you.
Then let's see what you have for sale.
What's life like around here?
You know, your mother asked me to seek a bride for you.
Nothing, nevermind.

node.text: Greetings and welcome to Timberwell, traveler. Feel free to use my forge, it's the only one in these parts. Now, is there something I can do for you?

option.optiontext: A man named Jonas told me I might get a pickaxe from you.
Do you have any tools I could buy?
What's life like around here?
You know, your mother asked me to seek a bride for you.
Anything you could teach me about forging?
Nothing, nevermind.

node.text: Ah, I see. Sure, I owe Jonas a favor but I can only afford to spare the one.

option.optiontext: Okay, thanks.

node.text: Don't mention it, I'm sure he knows it's needed. Do you need anything else?

option.optiontext: Do you have any other tools I could buy?
What's life like around here?
Thanks, that's all.

node.text: Wonderful, if you ask me! Birds sing every morning and the river's full of fish. The Mossneedle Pond northeast is quite beautiful, but try not to get lost in the woods on your way, or you might be set upon by wolves.

option.optiontext: A man named Jonas told me I might get a pickaxe from you.
Do you have any tools I could buy?
You know, your mother asked me to seek a bride for you.
Alright, take care.

node.text: Oh, ah... She did, did she? I see. Well, please don't send just anyone our way? I wish I'd meet someone who sees beauty in nature like I do. Delights in the song of birds, the rustle of leaves in the wind, and the...

option.optiontext: Yes, yes, okay. Do you have any tools I could buy?
Okay, I get it. I'll try to keep that in mind, I guess.

node.text: Oh, hello? I'm Helga. Just Helga, please, I don't like surnames. Who might you be?

option.optiontext: Pleased to meet you, Helga. I'm Rothar.
Lord Aercrest to you, peasant. I insist on surnames.
I'm leaving.

node.text: That's a nice name. What can I do for you, Rothar?

option.optiontext: You live alone out here?
Are you some kind of herbalist?
Just passing.

node.text: Oh not at all! I have my cat, Furrball, to keep me company. And the Summervale boy, Aaron, comes around ever so often. He's a nice lad, don't much care for the others in the village, think some of them would like to burn me for a witch or something.

option.optiontext: Why do they think you're a witch?
I see, talk to you later.

node.text: Because they are village simpletons? Because I don't fit in and prefer to live by myself out here, talking to my plants. And to Furrball, obviously - he's a good listener.

option.optiontext: So what's your interest in plants?
I see, talk to you later.

node.text: Oh, don't get me started on plants! They are just so magical and there's such a variety of them! They have different needs when they grow and they can be used in so many different potions for such different effects! There's a whole universe within plants!

option.optiontext: I get it, you're some kind of herbalist.
I see, talk to you later.

node.text: You could call me that. If you're interested in learning about plants and potions, feel free to use my workbench inside the house. Some of the plants I grow here can be turned into simple potions too, nothing fancy mind you.

option.optiontext: Do you live all alone out here?
Okay, thanks.

node.text: *giggles* Oh my! An actual lord, are we? What can I do for you then, 'Lord Aercrest'?

option.optiontext: You live alone out here?
Are you some kind of herbalist?
Just passing.
