node.text: Hello again, Rothar-dear! What can I do for you?

option.optiontext: You live alone out here?
Are you some kind of herbalist?
Just passing.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77> *Helga does a mocking curtsy* </color> \n My dear ''Lord Aercrest'', welcome back to my humble villa! What might this humble peasant do for you?

option.optiontext: You live alone out here?
Are you some kind of herbalist?
Ugh, just call me Rothar from now on.
Just passing.

node.text: Hehe! As you wish, Rothar-dear. Now what can I do for you?

option.optiontext: You live alone out here?
Are you some kind of herbalist?
Just passing.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77> *Furrball looks at you inquisitively.* </color>

option.optiontext: Pet Furrball.
Talk to Furrball about your problems.
Pet him some more.
Talk to Furrball about your problems.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77> *Furrball listens attentively while you pour your heart out. When you're done, he gives you a comforting headbutt.* </color>

option.optiontext: Pet Furrball.

node.text: Purrr...! Purrr...! Purrr...!

option.optiontext: Pet him some more.
Talk to Furrball about your problems.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77> *Furrball gives your hand a firm nibble - enough affection for now!* </color>

option.optiontext: Talk to Furrball about your problems.

node.text: In all my years I ain't never seen a storm like this around here...

option.optiontext: Excuse me, I'm looking for a way to Haywind.
What's your village like normally?
Weather's always been awful in Imberthale, take care now.

node.text: Why you askin'? You lost, boy? Nobody comes to Spruce Shade's Rest these days unless they're lost. Or maybe hiding, I guess...

Ah, well... It's exactly how it looks; a few sorry houses amidst bunch of trees. Some folk still get buried here, though. Glad there are still a few of us left livin', 'cause somebody needs to take care of this place and I'm starting to be a little too old for it meself.

option.optiontext: I'm looking for a way to Haywind.
I saw the underground tombs, seems like a lot for such a small village.
Take care now.

node.text: Oh dear, no! We only look after the graveyard above ground. Underground it's a vast Halls of the Dead from a time people still built such things.

Nobody really goes down there anymore, not with good intentions anyway. People were known to disappear into its depths before and I think a lot of corridors were once locked up to prevent that. Still, I think a lot of secrets and old legends are buried there.

option.optiontext: Who'd have the key to get past the locked crypt doors?
I'm looking for a way to Haywind.
Take care now.

node.text: Oh, who knows anymore! The locks were put up long before me and even I'm starting to be quite old, you know?

option.optiontext: I'm looking for a way to Haywind.
Take care now.

node.text: 'course you are, nowadays that's all folk seem intent on going. Just follow the road west, you'll end up in Haywind eventually. There's a stableboy in Timberwell who can speed your way.

option.optiontext: Anything you can tell me about Haywind?
What's your village like?
Take care now.

node.text: It's become the center of the world for some folk, but I'm the wrong woman to ask why. When I was a young lass, Haywind was little larger my own village. Ha! Bet hearing that'd shock some of the folk living there now!

Well, if you're heading that way, you can see for yourself how different things are now. I never understood the point of a city anyway. They stink worse than a pigsty and you can't grow crops, it's stupid.

option.optiontext: What's your village like, then?
Take care now.

node.text: Oi, this is my dig! Find yer own place to loot!

option.optiontext: How about we trade?
I'm not here to scavenge. I don't see anything of value anyway, just ruins.

node.text: Yeaaah, you're probably right. But ye never know, there might be a bracelet or sumtin' buried beneath the mud.

option.optiontext: What's this place anyway?
How about we trade?
I should go.

node.text: Used to be a village here but t'was abandoned ages ago. Probably because of the thing with the ruined fort. Hope ye weren't planning on going there, by the way, best stay clear of it.

option.optiontext: Why? What's wrong with the fort?
How about we trade?
Alright, I should go.

node.text: Is haunted is what it is. Called Greywall or sumtin', been that way for as long as anyone can remember. Ain't no joke either, no children's tale, is haunted for real! Ain't no one gone in there that ever came back.

option.optiontext: How about we trade?
Chilling. I should go.

node.text: Yeah, what do you want?

option.optiontext: How about we trade?
What is this place?
Nothing, nevermind.

node.text: Curious... Very curious...

option.optiontext: Just show me what you're selling.
Sorry, but what's curious?

node.text: Oh, nothing. I just realized that I remember every wand I've ever sold.

option.optiontext: Is it true that the wand chooses the wizard?
Let's see what you're selling.

node.text: What? Hah! Hahaha! No, of course not! Wherever did you hear such ridiculous nonsense?

option.optiontext: Nevermind, just show me what you're selling.

node.text: If you're looking for magical rings, you've come to the right place. I'm a real expert in the craft, if I do say so myself.

option.optiontext: Then let's see what you have for sale.
Really? How many rings have you made?

node.text: Well let's see... one time I made three rings fit for kings, then there were seven for little lads living in stone halls of all places...

option.optiontext: Go on.
I've heard enough, let's see what you have.

node.text: Oh yeah, and one time nine rings for men, who were actually doomed to die. Here's the crazy part, one ring I made...!

option.optiontext: I've heard enough, let's see what you have.
Okay, goodbye.

node.text: I ain't got much, but I'll give a fair price.

option.optiontext: Sounds good to me.
How's business?

node.text: What does it look like, the busiest trading post in all of Imberthale? I keep these folk supplied, because somebody has to.

option.optiontext: I'll have a look at those wares then.

node.text: Greetings to you, pale traveler! May I entice you with our finest local cheese, or perhaps you're in the mood for a taste of wine from the city of Traire?

option.optiontext: Sure, let me browse your wares.
Fancy shop for a small town, isn't it?
No thank you.

node.text: Not at all, sir! I assure you, here in Grainwater we have something called culture! Something those haughty Haywinders aren't able to understand.

option.optiontext: Let me see those wares then.
Thanks, maybe I'll come back another time.

node.text: Oh... um... hello?

option.optiontext: Looking to buy stuff.
Is that how you usually treat customers?

node.text: Um... yes...

option.optiontext: Just show me your wares.

node.text: Greetins', fella! Welcome to me shop, which I dare ya is every bit as good as that lassie's on the northern district. Don't let anyone tell ya otherwise!

option.optiontext: I'm looking for something specific - a focusing crystal used by magi and such folk.
Let's see then.
Folk prefer to shop elsewhere?
I'll come back later.

node.text: Yeh well I don't sell those things but just across the street there's a madlad who does all sorts of mad craft and I bet he's got what ya need so yeh, I reckon ya could give his door a knock, what d'ya say?

option.optiontext: Um... I should knock the door on the house right across?
Right, got it.

node.text: Well yeh 'cause this is sorta poorer part of the city but I keep a tight shop and my prices are right and my goods are good so what d'ya say?

option.optiontext: I'm looking for something specific - a focusing crystal used by magi and such folk.
Let's see then.
I'll come back later.

node.text: I hope you're here for my beautiful candles, sir. It's just... there's this weird alchemist lady who only ever wants to buy candle wax. And for whatever nefarious purposes? This is a candle shop, I say!

option.optiontext: Let's see.
Maybe later.

node.text: Hi, there! Did you know my sister is a teacher at the Haywind College? I'm so proud of her! Anyway, what can I do for you?

option.optiontext: What do you sell?
You're an alchemist?
Nothing for now.

node.text: That's right! I don't claim to be an expert, like that odd hermit Xerxes who lives near Oldroot Forest, but I do alright.

option.optiontext: Let me see what you have for sale.
I see, goodbye.

node.text: Y'know the seamstress, Olivia? Fancied her once, but she went on and married that oaf Hunter. What she saw in him, I'll never know. Now I buy my leather from Hunter. Life's a strange thing, innit...

option.optiontext: I'm just here to shop, sir...
I met an old hunter in the woods who told me to bring these animal skins to you.

node.text: Halt, traveler! The farms ahead are being raided! We're trying to push back the bandit marauders but they're putting up hell of a fight, best steer clear.

option.optiontext: I might be able to help.

node.text: I won't turn away an extra fighter, just be warned it's a fight you might not be walking away from.

option.optiontext: We'll see.

node.text: Got more copper for me? Always willing to pay a fair price for a lump of 10.

option.optiontext: I have it.
Not today.

node.text: Greetins' lad! You good with a pick? We got too many quotas to fill and not enough pick swingers.

option.optiontext: What do you need?
I'm busy.

node.text: For now, just copper. Lots of copper. I won't lie, I can't pay much, but I can promise there'll be as much work here as you're only willing to do.

option.optiontext: Honest labor is good for the soul, my father always said. How much copper do you need?
I'm busy with more important matters.

node.text: All of it, but for starters bring me 10 lumps and I'll deal you a few coins in return.

option.optiontext: Simple enough.

node.text: Got some of that copper I asked for?

option.optiontext: I do.
Not right now.

node.text: Good stuff! Now, what I offer is below market price, but we all gotta make ends meet, innit? Do come back if you wanna trade more copper.
These poor souls. The society rejects them, it is so unjust! I believe every human being has a right to a full belly, don't you agree?

option.optiontext: Oh yes indeed, I agree!
I'd love to stay and chat, but I'm in a terrible hurry.

node.text: I knew you were a man with a good heart the moment I saw you! Then you'll also know that a vegetable stew simply can't be made without a lot of vegetables.
Bring me 5 carrots, cabbages, and corn, would you? All as a donation for the poor, of course. But don't take too long, these poor souls are hungry.

option.optiontext: Oh, um... okay, I guess...

node.text: They're really hungry, I can tell... I heard rumors the last charity worker disappeared... down into the stew cauldron... Please tell me you have the vegetables I asked?

option.optiontext: Worry not, I have them.
I'll do my best.

node.text: Oh, phew! Haha! Thank you stranger, you really are a kind man. This ought to keep these poor people satiated, although...

option.optiontext: What is it?

node.text: They could use a bit more meat on them bones. I mean real meat. You wouldn't mind bringing me 4 cooked chicken and 2 cooked pebble sturgeon, would you?

option.optiontext: I guess I wouldn't...

node.text: They need meat you know, just to make sure they don't go hungry.

option.optiontext: I bring the meat.
Yes, I'll be back.

node.text: Oh you wonderful, wonderful man! You've saved my life! Metaphorically speaking, of course, maybe... Anyway, there's this family recipe I'd like to give you.
But I don't have it right now, so you'll just have to make do with the experience you've had and the friends you made along this journey.

option.optiontext: Okay, I'm done with you.

node.text: I spent my younger days chasing wolves, bears and other terrifying beasts of the forest. Nowadays it's the smaller critters hiding in plain sight that excite me.

option.optiontext: Good for you.

node.text: Why, in truth they provide far more of a challenge. How about you, are you up for a challenge?

option.optiontext: Sure, what is it?
I don't have time for this.

node.text: Do you think you'd be able to find the perfect rabbit ears, hm? How about the perfect crab claws, or the perfect bat wings? Bring me all these things, that is the challenge.

option.optiontext: How would I know if they're perfect?
Depends - where do I find rabbits, crabs and bats?
Shouldn't be difficult.

node.text: Oh, you'll know perfection when you see it. You just have to hunt for it.

option.optiontext: And where do I find rabbits, crabs and bats?
Shouldn't be difficult.

node.text: If I told you that, it wouldn't be much of a hunt now would it?

option.optiontext: And how do I recognize if the parts are perfect?
Shouldn't be difficult.

node.text: Very well. If you do find them, I can tell you what to do with them afterwards. Good luck!
How goes your hunt, friend? Perfection is not so easily attained, is it? Hehe.

option.optiontext: I collected animal parts that look pretty perfect to me.
Is there a point to this critter hunt?
You wouldn't mind giving a few tips where crabs and bats can be hunted?

node.text: Indeed? But so I see - you must have hunted long for the perfect critters to attain these. Although the smaller creatures are often overlooked by many proud hunters, I assure you, your efforts will not go unrewarded.

option.optiontext: They better not.

node.text: Take the critterskins you found, alongside 4 cowhides, to the leatherworker in Haywind. Then you'll see what secret power even small animals can hold, hehe!

option.optiontext: The leatherworker - where do I find him?
Where do I find cowhide?

node.text: Young Arnold is the best man for the job in Haywind. When you're near the northern gates - the Rivergate they call it - you'll know you're not far from his workshop.

option.optiontext: What about cowhide?

node.text: But surely a skilled hunter such as yourself can figure that out?

option.optiontext: Yeah okay, what about the leatherworker?

node.text: Oh, you young people are so rash. Always in need of everything upfront. Can't you enjoy the moment - the hunt?

option.optiontext: I'm not that young, you know...
You wouldn't mind giving a few tips where crabs and bats can be hunted?
Well, I collected animal parts that look pretty perfect to me.
Nevermind then.

node.text: Heh... well, even I must admit you must've seen better years, young man. But then again, everyone must be young compared to me.

option.optiontext: You wouldn't mind giving a few tips where crabs and bats can be hunted?
In any case, I collected animal parts that look pretty perfect to me.
I should go.

node.text: If I told you that, it wouldn't be much of a hunt now would it? Heeheehee...

option.optiontext: Is there even a point to this critter hunt?
Well actually, I've already collected animal parts that look pretty perfect to me.
Of course not...

node.text: What's this then? Ah I see, it's that old creep and his weird hunting shenanigans again. Fine, I can work these parts into something, just need a payment of fifty coins is all.

option.optiontext: I still don't know what this is for, but it better be worth it. <color=orange> (50 coins) </color>
Maybe I'll come back later then.

node.text: Yeah, well... Just give me a second...
There! It ain't a lot of material to work with, but it amounts to a neat bracer. All yours!
Age has stripped me of my sight, but my nose still works fine. You have the smell of death about you.

option.optiontext: Can you tell me how to get to Haywind from here?
What can you tell me about Timberwell?

node.text: Everybody's looking to get to Haywind, eh? At this rate all roads will lead to Haywind, but for now you'll want to take the one towards west. The journey's quick on horseback and the stable can rent a horse for you, if you have the coin.

option.optiontext: What can you tell me about Timberwell?
Alright, thanks.

node.text: Oh, this is a young settlement. The Summervale family was the first to come but many others followed. There are many looking to live a quiet life you know, who've felt displaced as the city of Haywind's grown over recent decades.

'Course, it's a shame about the druids. When I was a young lass living in Spruce Shade's Rest, the forests were abuzz with them. But much like Haywind City, the people here now are nothing but a disruption to their way of life.

option.optiontext: Speaking of which, how do I get to Haywind from here?

node.text: Well I got bread, is on'y five nights old. Dip it in beer, it'll be alright.

option.optiontext: Erm, I was hoping for something a little more exciting.

node.text: Why, bread not good enough for yeh? I bet you're one of them city folk, aren't you? Well, that don't mean I couldn't make something nice for yeh.\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*You observe Wendy grill some meats on a skewer with practiced hands. You're confident you could replicate her work.*</color>
Here you go, hope it's good enough for your ''grace''.\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*You've unlocked the cooking recipe for Woodland Skewer!*</color>
No witches allowed in 'ere!

option.optiontext: Just show me the menu.
I'm not a witch...?
How would I get to Haywind from here?
No witch - just a hungry man. <color=orange> (40 coins) </color>

node.text: Just making sure, is all. Can't be too careful, ever since that witch Helga settled by the river east.

option.optiontext: How do you know she's a witch?
How would I get to Haywind from here?
I'm no witch - just a hungry man. <color=orange> (40 coins) </color>
Just show me the menu.

node.text: She lives with a cat, her name's Helga which is a total witch name, and everyone says she's weird and suspicious-like. What more proof do you need?

option.optiontext: How would I get to Haywind from here?
Well, I'm no witch - just a hungry man. <color=orange> (40 coins) </color>
Just show me the menu.

node.text: Eh? You need to ask? You drop off a grainwagon or something? Talk to the stableboy opposite side, give 'im a few coins and he'll set you on your way with a horse.

option.optiontext: What's on the menu?
Got anything special for a hungry man? <color=orange> (40 coins) </color>
Alright, thanks.

node.text: Before you ask, no I do not have love potions. Such things are old wives' tales and can you imagine how highly unethical they'd be if they actually did exist? What I can offer is the most common tonics to boost mind and health.

option.optiontext: Let's see what you have.
Do you brew them yourself?
Maybe another time.

node.text: Oh gosh no, I wouldn't even know how to begin. I source them from here and there, all confidential mind you. But if you must know, the Sporelake sisters in Haywind know a thing or two about alchemy.

option.optiontext: Really? Where would I find them?
Let's see your stock.

node.text: *sigh*\nOne of them is a teacher at that pretentious academy on the other side of the market place. I think the other one brews potions in a miserable hut somewhere in northwest Haywind. Now are you going to buy something or not?

option.optiontext: Yeah, sure.
No, thank you.

node.text: Fancy anything you see? Trust me, wearing my rings around the city will make you feel like a real Lord.

option.optiontext: Is that so? Let's talk price.
I quite know how that feels already, thank you very much.

node.text: Welcome, proud home owner! That is, I assume you are a home owner? I mean, why else would yo want to buy furniture, am I right?

option.optiontext: Did you write this book? <color=#9C8C77> (show The Home Owner's Manual) </color>
I'm a traveler looking for work.
What was the task again?
Here, I've brought the logs you asked for.
Not today.

node.text: Ha! You bought that? That's great! I made a fair few coins out of that sca... ahem... endeavor. Now, I ain't writing no autographs, alright? But if you wanna buy furniture...?

option.optiontext: Fine, I'll have a look.
Not today.

node.text: I recognize you! You're the, err... 'person', who saved my life at Spruce Shade Cemetery! Don't worry, your secret's safe with me - I won't tell anyone what I saw back there.

Listen, I didn't get a chance to properly reward you back there, but I owe you a debt for saving my life! I don't have much, but my old family heirlooms may still hold some value with certain collectors. As far as I'm concerned, you can have them!

option.optiontext: What will you do now?
Thanks, take care now. Er, no pun intended...

node.text: I'm not quite sure... Never going back to that dreary place in Spruce Shade's Rest, that's for sure! I was hoping they'd take me on here at Haywind Cemetery, but I just discovered they have problems with the undead in the crypts here too...

I became a cemetery caretaker for the peace and quiet of it, but now I'm starting to feel like it's not peaceful and quiet at all! Everywhere I turn, I see undead monsters! Erm, no offence meant to you, of course... sir...

option.optiontext: No worries, take care now. Er, no pun intended...
No worries, take care now. Er, no pun intended...

node.text: Don't worry, your secret's safe with me - I won't tell anyone what I saw back there, at Spruce Shade Cemetery... I don't know how to help you, maybe some of the priests would know how to help someone with your... condition?
Then again, most folk might not be very understanding of it, might be wise to just stay quiet...

option.optiontext: What will you do now?
Take care now, Master Caretaker.

node.text: If you're transporting valuable goods to Thornhill, you should declare them now. Any attempt to evade the Lord's taxes is an egregious offence, and I have the authority to issue devastating fines for even minor infractions!

option.optiontext: Who are you?
What is this place?
What kind of people will I find here?

node.text: The master of this trade station, in case that wasn't obvious! You should know that I'm a very busy man and my time is not to be wasted! If you're a merchant, you should declare yourself now!

option.optiontext: Tell me about this place.
What kind of people will I find here?

node.text: This trade station has been placed here by the Lord Mayor of Thornhill himself, to observe that merchants traveling on this route pay the appropriate tolls, taxes and fees. You ought to move along, you're holding up merchants conducting business with the city!

option.optiontext: What kind of people will I find here?
Who are you again?

node.text: Merchants of all sorts, mostly from Melloria. There's one, Lodbrok, who travels between here and the far northern wilds of Imberthale. You might want to talk to him if you're heading that way yourself.

option.optiontext: Who are you again?
Tell me about this place.

node.text: My caravan's headed all the way north, to Evergreen Hearth. You're welcome to travel with us, if you're headed that way. Journey's always safer the more of us there are on the road.

option.optiontext: Very well, I'm ready to travel.
Very well, I'm ready to travel.
Evergreen Hearth? Not sure I've heard of it before.

node.text: A village in the northernmost reaches of Imberthale, deep within Winterpine Forests. It's a home for many lumberjacks, for the wood that grows there is of very high quality. It's the wood that I'm personally looking to trade, in exchange for common supplies.

option.optiontext: What's it like up there?
Very well, I'm ready to travel.
Very well, I'm ready to travel.
I see.

node.text: At this time? Frozen to the core, and the sun never rises. The woodlands are fairly hostile with beasts and other creatures, but the village is cozy enough. I know I won't be straying far from it myself.

option.optiontext: Evergreen Hearth? Not sure I've heard of it before.
Very well, I'm ready to travel.
Very well, I'm ready to travel.
I see.

node.text: Alright there, traveler? Our crates are all loaded up on winterpine wood, might be heading back towards Thornhill soon. Let us know if you want to travel with us.

option.optiontext: No point in dallying, I'm ready to travel.

node.text: Greetings, traveler! I haven't seen a new face in these parts for quite some time. What brings you to our humble village?

option.optiontext: I'm seeking adventure and heard there are rumors of treasure in these lands.
I'm passing through on my way to the neighboring town. Anything interesting to see here?
Actually, I should be on my way. Thank you for your hospitality.

node.text: Ah, the allure of treasure! Many have come seeking fortune, but few have returned. The ancient ruins to the east are said to hold unimaginable riches, but they are also guarded by powerful enchantments. Do you dare to venture into the unknown?

option.optiontext: I am no stranger to danger. I'll explore the ruins and claim the treasure!
Tell me more about the neighboring town. What can I expect to find there?
Perhaps another time. I'll continue on my journey for now.

node.text: Our village may seem quaint, but it has its own charm. You can visit the lively market square where local artisans display their crafts or take a stroll through the serene forest nearby. If you're a history enthusiast, the village museum showcases relics from our rich past.

option.optiontext: I'd love to explore the market square and see the local crafts.
The serene forest sounds like a peaceful escape. I'll take a walk there.
Tell me more about the neighboring town. What can I expect to find there?
What can you tell me about the rumored treasure in these lands?
Actually, I should be on my way. Thank you for your hospitality.

node.text: Brave adventurer, may luck be on your side! Remember, the ruins are treacherous, and the challenges within are not to be taken lightly. Return safely, and may the treasures you find be worth the risk!

option.optiontext: Thank you for your words of encouragement. I'll make sure to return with great tales to share!

node.text: The market square is a vibrant hub of activity. You'll find a plethora of stalls selling everything from exquisite handcrafted jewelry to aromatic spices and freshly baked goods. It's a feast for the senses!

option.optiontext: I'll definitely visit the market square and explore the local crafts. Thank you for the recommendation!
What can you tell me about the rumored treasure in these lands?
Actually, I should be on my way. Thank you for your hospitality.

node.text: The serene forest is a hidden gem. As you walk along the winding paths, you'll hear the soothing sound of birdsong and feel the gentle breeze rustling through the leaves. It's a perfect retreat to connect with nature.

option.optiontext: I'll take a leisurely walk through the serene forest. Thank you for the suggestion!
What can you tell me about the rumored treasure in these lands?
Actually, I should be on my way. Thank you for your hospitality.

node.text: The neighboring town is vibrant and offers a variety of attractions. From the grand cathedral that showcases stunning architecture to the bustling marketplace where you can find exotic goods from distant lands, there's something for everyone. It's definitely worth a visit!

option.optiontext: I'm intrigued! I'll visit the neighboring town and explore its attractions.
What can you tell me about the rumored treasure in these lands?
Actually, I should be on my way. Thank you for your hospitality.

node.text: Aye, you busy, lil guy? An ol timer like myself needs some help every now and then, you know?

option.optiontext: Err, okay?
Yes, busy. Very busy! Too busy, in fact, for whatever mundane and pathetic task you are going to request of me.

node.text: So Imma cook somethin' real good up, ye know what Im sayin? I just dont have all the ingredients I need. The stew is almost done, but it aint got no meat! I needs fish. Not jus any ol fish, but a REAL special type. Special fishes. Three o' them. Fishes.

option.optiontext: What makes these fish so damn special, old man?
Special fishes. Three of them. Three special fishes.

node.text: What makes a fish special? A diet of fairy farts, sparkling frog toes, dogwood blossoms, and sand crab droppings - add in a blessing from the god o' birthdays, of course! Blessed their eyes hisself. The eyes are the best part. Roll em' in dirt. Taste like fresh rabbit eyes - but with dirt. Dirts the secret ingredient. And eyes.

option.optiontext: Umm, anyways...

node.text: Aye, three of em special fishes. Thing is, you cant get these here fish in just any ol' pond. Well, maybe you can - I dunno, never really left this town. Born and raised off them fishes, I was. Anyways, its out near close to where them TROLLS lurk - them big nasties thatll crush ye without a second thought. Id get it myself, but wouldnt ya know these ol weathered joints in my arms cant handle a fishin rod like they used to, so Imma need a youngun like you to get it fo' me. Plus, I dun wanna die. Whaddya say?

option.optiontext: Sounds like a reasonable proposal.
Gods no, not another fetch quest!

node.text: Right, so head outside the town gates. It dun matter which set, jus' head west around the side o' the wall and you'll see the crescent-shaped pond - edge o the thing is practically against the walls o the keep. Juss go an get me three o them fishes, and Ill reward ye handsomely. Three fishes. Three.

option.optiontext: I shall return with the fish.

node.text: You get me fishes yet? Three of em? Three fishes? You git it dun yet, youngin?

option.optiontext: What was I supposed to get again? And how many of them? And where?
No, not yet.
I've got your fishes right here, old man. There are three of them. Three. I counted them myself. Three fishes.

node.text: OUTSIDE THE TOWN. WEST. POND. THREE. FISHES.

option.optiontext: Ah, okay.

node.text: FISHES. THREE. OF. THEM. YA CROUTON! *holds up 3 fingers angrily*

option.optiontext: Right, got it.

node.text: THREE. *inhales*

option.optiontext: FOR FUCK'S SAKE - I'm leaving! Calm the fuck down, old man!

node.text: Thur' we go! Can't wait to eat them eyeballs! Theysa bulgin' right out o' them fishy skulls! Not bad fer a youngin, you be. Here, have some gold, and thank ye!

option.optiontext: Right. Have fun with your fishes. All three of them. That would be six eyeballs, mind you. Anyways, I'm off.

node.text: Thank ye again fo helping with me stew!

option.optiontext: Right. The stew with the fishes. Three of them. Three fishes. Three special fishes.

node.text: Hooman! You too old to make stew. Need young, tender hooman. Good flesh soft, but loud cries. Best meat from hoomans no walk yet. Good chef cook tip - always cut head off first so no hear screams when skin.

option.optiontext: Nope, nope nope nope! Not having this conversation.

node.text: Meat slide right off bone. No need remove bone though, bones tiny and crunch good in teeth. You like young hooman meat?

option.optiontext: Children? CHILDREN? WE DON'T EAT OUR CHILDREN. We are civilized! We don't eat any of our own, that's disgusting!

node.text: Then let dead hooman meat go waste? Why waste good meat?

option.optiontext: We HONOR our dead by burying them, not cannibalaising them!

node.text: Troll honor dead by consume them. Their meat become our meat.

option.optiontext: Oh. Thats...um, I don't want it to make sense, but it does.

node.text: So, hooman get me child-dren meat for stew?

option.optiontext: What!? No, I will NOT kidnap some child for you to cook!

node.text: Then hooman get special meat for stew?

option.optiontext: Special meat?

node.text: *Speaking slowly* Speh-shul meeeeee-aaaat.

option.optiontext: I know what you said, but what is special meat?

node.text: Best meat for stew. Wise troll help you get. Need sacred charm from wise troll though. To talk wise troll, you need shiny.

Round shiny. Many shiny. Big handful of shiny. Sand color shiny hoomans carry in pouch. Sometimes big box of shiny on cart with the big dogs. The big dogs not have as good meat as hoomans though. Especially young hoomans.

option.optiontext: Coins? Round, golden pieces of metal used as currency in exchange for goods or services?

node.text: Hur funny hooman words. Bring handful of shiny rounds to wise troll. Tell him cook want you get special meat box. He tell you how.

option.optiontext: Meh, why not? I'm in need of an adventure. I'll come back with a box of special meat, or whatever.
Sorry, not today. But hey, thank you for this meaningful and insightful conversation.

node.text: Hooman talk to wise troll about get meat for stew?

option.optiontext: Err, working on it.
I have a box of suspicious...err, 'special' meat right here.

Actually, I am having a problem with the riddle. I admit that I am too stupid and do not have that intelligence required to figure out such an elementary conundrum about getting a troll, child, and coins across a river.

node.text: OOH! I HELP I HELP! Smelly hooman first! Go back, grab other thing, take other side. Take hooman back start! Grab other and bring over. Go get hooman and done! ME LOVE RIDDLES MORE THAN COOK MEAT.

option.optiontext: Whoa! Um, thanks? Hmm, I really should learn to think for myself.

node.text: Cook thank hooman! Cook can now make greatest stew ever with meat socks! Best hooman! Troll give hooman shiny rounds to eat! Here, cook show thank by teach puny hooman to chop and cook big meats! Come, cook show how!

option.optiontext: Oh, neat.

node.text: Cook favorite hooman back! Hi puny hooman!

option.optiontext: Hi Cook!

node.text: Why is hooman here? What does hooman want? WHY does hooman?

option.optiontext: Wrong troll, sorry.

node.text: What you want?

option.optiontext: Ah, nothing.

node.text: Why is hooman here? What does hooman want? WHY does hooman?

option.optiontext: Greetings, exhalted one. I was told to bring you an offering of many round shiny as I seek your audience.

node.text: Gib wise troll many shiny rounds as hooman have hand-fingers and foot-fingers, then get chance at riddle. Pass riddle, get wise troll help.

option.optiontext: Here, twenty coins. Now give me the stupid riddle.
Err, not thanks

node.text: There is river. You is cross river with bridge. You have troll with no legs. Puny youngling hooman that no walk, only cry loud. And big bag of shiny rounds. All need cross river.
You can no leave troll and youngling hooman, or troll eat hooman. You can no leave youngling hooman and bag of shiny rounds, or hooman eat shiny rounds. No leave alone or kill.

option.optiontext: Thats absurd! We humans don't eat coins!
Coins, seriously? Bah, whatever. Okay, humans eat coins in this riddle. Got it. Get on with it, wise troll.

node.text: If no for eat, why all hooman troll kill have bag of shiny rounds? If no for eat, then wut?

option.optiontext: We give the coins to others in exchange for food.
Doesn't matter. Riddle, now!

node.text: Hoomans dumb! Why no save time and just eat shiny round?

option.optiontext: We can't eat them, their made of gold - which ISN'T food, if you didn't notice.

node.text: Oh. That why hooman in cage always die when try to feed shiny rounds? I never see hooman eat shiny, now that me think it.
node.comment: Here is a location for long dialogue of philosophical bullshit to give the wise troll depth as option 2 later.

option.optiontext: Oh my...for fuck's sake, just give me the damn riddle already!

node.text: What do?

option.optiontext: Take the troll across river and place it on the other side.
Take the child across river and place it on the other side.
Take the coins across river and place it on the other side.
I go over empty-handed to the other side.

node.text: Youngling hooman eat bag of shiny rounds when you gone. HOOMAN LOSE. BRING MORE SHINY FOR TRY AGAIN.

option.optiontext: Shit, I'm such a dumbass. You literally JUST went over this. I should feel really bad about myself.

node.text: You leave all alone? Hooman eat shiny bag, troll eat hooman! HOOMAN LOSE. BRING MORE SHINY FOR TRY AGAIN.

option.optiontext: Wow, that was fucking stupid of me. I should feel really bad about myself.

node.text: Troll chomp youngling hooman in half when you go away! HOOMAN LOSE. BRING MORE SHINY FOR TRY AGAIN.

option.optiontext: Bah, that was fucking stupid of me. You literally JUST went over this. I should feel really bad about myself.

node.text: You on other side of bridge with hooman. Now wut do?

option.optiontext: I go back to the side I started at.
I take the child back to the side I started at.
I toss the child into the river because riddles are stupid. I don't want to deal with this crap.

node.text: You back at start bridge now with troll and shiny bag. Wut do?

option.optiontext: Next I take the troll across river and place it on the other side.
Next I take the coins across river and place it on the other side.

node.text: You on other side with hooman and troll. Now wut do?

option.optiontext: I go back to the side I started at.
I take the troll back to the start and place it down again.
I take the child back to the start and place it down again.

node.text: You on other side with hooman and shiny bag. Now wut do?

option.optiontext: I go back to the side I started at.
I take the child back to the start and place it down again.
I take the coins back to the start and place them down again.

node.text: You at start with troll and hooman. Wut do?

option.optiontext: I go back to the other side.
I take the child to the other side and place it down again.
I take the troll to the other side and place it down again.

node.text: WRONG! Troll ate hooman you left alone! HOOMAN LOSE. BRING MORE SHINY FOR TRY AGAIN.

option.optiontext: How do I even manage to feed myself on a daily basis? I'm a fucking idiot! I should feel really bad about myself.

node.text: You at start with hooman and shiny bag. Wut do?

option.optiontext: I go back to the other side.
Next I take the child across river and place it on the other side.
Next I take the coins across river and place it on the other side.

node.text: You on other side with shiny bag and troll. Now wut do?

option.optiontext: Oh for fuck's sake! I HATE riddles! I go back. I bring the kid over. It's done. The stupid riddle is done.

node.text: Hooman finish riddle! Wise troll help with the thing now. What need?

option.optiontext: Finally. The cook wants me to get a 'special meat box' and apparently I need some sort of charm or something, and more information as to where I would find a box of meat.

node.text: Here sacred charm. Show to meat man when find him. He know what do. Tell him we get more meat for him to make tiny meat socks out of. He owe us box of meat socks from last time.

option.optiontext: This is...oh wow, thats a lot of...human...baby...skulls. Anyways - I find the meat man and show him this disgusting thing, he gives me a box, I bring it back? Okay, so where is this 'meat' man?

node.text: Meat man go by name Cain.

option.optiontext: ...and where is this 'Cain' residing?
Oh! I know who he is. Right outside of Haywind. Sells sausage - err, 'meat socks'. Kind of an odd little fellow. Got it - I'll return with the 'meat socks'.

node.text: Outside of town with river through it. That way, but not close town. Other town. *the wise troll points southwest*

option.optiontext: Okay, outside of Haywind. Got it.

node.text: Wut you want?

option.optiontext: What was I supposed to do again?

node.text: Find Cain. Outside of town hooman call 'HAE-WEND'. Show charm. Bring meat socks back. Dat way. *points southwest*
*Stares off into the woodline*
Of course! Been waiting for someone to get sent out here for it. Took longer than usual.

option.optiontext: Is this a regular occurance?

node.text: Not one of the usual ones, are you? Where they keep some of your kin and release ya'll when you get back? If they let you live this long, they probably won't kill you. It's the only way they can trade with us people.

option.optiontext: How are you even remotely okay with this!?

node.text: Oh, I never said I was okay with it. Just the way of the world - business and all that. Got to find a buyer for my special products, you know?

option.optiontext: What makes this meat so special compared to the other meats? Why do they want it more than other meats?

node.text: It's basically whatever I can find around here that's made of meat. This particular sausage consist of all the other parts I don't use in the other products. You know, 'novelty' parts. Lips and...

Well, the special meat blend recipe AND my secret blend of twelve herbs and spices. But, thats not why they continue to do business with me...apart from our outstanding product, we here at Abel farms pride ourselves on our relationships with vendors and consumers of all types - troll or not - and the communities in which we operate...
Heh, probably someone's kin that didn't return with this here crate of sausage.
What? Nothing. Heh. Here's your meat socks for the trolls. Hurry along now.

option.optiontext: Right, I should REALLY be leaving now.

node.text: Thanks for choosing Abel farms!
Always choose Abel farms for your specialty meat needs!

option.optiontext: I'm looking for Cain...?
I am supposed to show you this charm...

node.text: Well, you get the point. Oh, and bits o' meat that have gone bad. Them trolls don't seem to mind spoiled meat as long as it's not too far gone - think green and not brown. Mix that with some soybean feed normally meant for the livestock, and combined with the leftover waste fibers from the cloth and yarn the tailors get rid of. The lint helps keep the ground meat product together so it doesn't crumble. Them trolls'll eat anything, I tell ya'.

option.optiontext: Soy? Lint? Green meat? Thats what the trolls want and crave?

node.text: We at Abel farms try our best to honor our customers with excellent products and cherish those that purchase them as they enable us to continue our goal of being the preferred meat vendor in the region. Without the community, we got nothing. Here at Abel farms in Haywind, the key ingredient is our people.

option.optiontext: Well, none of this conversation has been the least bit alarming by any means. Anyways, the trolls said they have more meat for you.

node.text: Three weapons lay on top of the stone slab, bathed in a faint glow. Is this the final resting place of a great warrior?

node.text: The weapon feels strangely cold in your hand. As soon as you remove it from the slab, you are immediately overcome with unimaginable sense of dread as you notice the other two weapons suddenly begin to glow...

option.optiontext: Oh, shi...

node.text: I told you to kill eight o' them rodent bastards that keep raiding our damn larders! Now go!

Let me see what you're selling.

node.text: I've found that a well shot arrow can solve almost any problem in the world. Have you come to learn?

Let me see what you're selling.
Not today.

node.text: You come seeking knowledge of the arcane?

node.text: This is true, which is why the people of Hydrobor often protest my presence here. They believe magical knowledge can cause terrible devastation in the wrong hands and so any who would learn needs to be closely vetted.

option.optiontext: You don't share their opinion?

Let me see what you're selling.

node.text: I believe everyone has a right to learn magic. And might I say, the most wicked spell casters ever to come out tend to have been academy trained.

Let me see what you're selling.

node.text: Everybody's always looking to learn how to use weapons, or shoot the bow. Real soldiers know the most important thing is staying alive in the first place - that's what I'm here to teach you.

option.optiontext: I'd like to learn.
Let me see what you're selling.

node.text: I do like teaching here in the city, but at times I still yearn to wander the tranquil forestlands.

option.optiontext: What can you teach me?
Let me see what you're selling.

node.text: Hello! I wouldn't call myself a learned man or anything, I just love fishing, but apparently I'm quite good at it so they asked me here to teach. Would you like to learn?

option.optiontext: Let me see what you're selling.
Not today.
Yes rocks, show me how to better break them?
Let me see what you're selling.

node.text: Oh, any old Imberthalesian relics, old artifacts! You see, I have achieved much in life, but now I feel it's time for me to take on a different role - one that guides others who wish to achieve great things!

When they do, they inevitably come by old artifacts! I am willing to collect all those artifacts and in exchange I will share some of the fruits of my own achievements; knowledge, special items, whatever it may be! And perhaps one day, once I've collected enough artifacts, I may open a grand museum to showcase them!

option.optiontext: Hi Kid, What are you doing here out in the forest?
Hope your town people are proud of you now!
I am working on oak logs to pile
Nothing, just passing through. Bye.

node.text: Winter is coming, and nobody listening to me about stocking up woods for harsh season,they saying they are afraid of trolls, so I stood up and working to gather woods for my town people, do you wanna help too?

option.optiontext: Brave!, Yes I'll help you
ehh...Best of luck maybe?

node.text: Yes all because of your help, Thankyou Uncle!

option.optiontext: My Pleasure

node.text: Hi there, Traveler, How are you?

option.optiontext: Hi, What do you do?
Hope this town looks beautiful.
How is this going to work?
Nothing, just passing through. Bye.

node.text: I am a gardner, I am on a mission to improve this village looks, do you wanna help me planting flowers around?

option.optiontext: I am busy right now!

node.text: Indeed it is!
1 flower bed is available on the east entrance, 1 is on the center of the town, and 1 is near the big dock.
Hi there, Traveler, How are you?

option.optiontext: Hi, Why are you hiding in here?
Whom to fight?
I defeated the drunkard guy!
Nothing, just passing through. Bye.

node.text: I like to challenge town folks who can drink strong beer and survive a fight!Do you want a challenge too?

option.optiontext: Yes, sure.
Maybe not, I am sober!

node.text: Its simple... Drink the beer I gave you and enter in the bar, everything comes at you
Well done, now if you like my beer you can buy it anytime
Do you want carve a log into a river canoe?

option.optiontext: Use the Spruce Log.
Use the Willow Log.
Use the Oak Log.
No, nevermind.

node.text: You take out the hatchet and the log and get to work... but where will you travel?

option.optiontext: Let's see...

node.text: This is the tomb of Druid Eremius, who could bring a lush garden to life even in the darkest of caves. This scroll, which commemorates his life and achievements, also contains blueprints for a curious creation of the druid's...

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Learn about the druid's creation.*</color>

node.text: The scroll outlines ways to carve and shape wood into a cabinet with magical properties, so that it miraculously restocks its own shelves with potions while you're away.\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*You've unlocked Crafting skill recipe for the 'Self-Replenishing Potion Cabinet' furniture.*</color>

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Learn more about the materials the cabinet requires.*</color>
Oh, neat!

node.text: The cabinet should be made from wood grown personally by the druid. However, the scroll warns against defiling the tomb grove at the penalty of a curse. Yet you notice wild scratches on the trees around you. Perhaps the surrounding undead have torn off twigs and bark?

Welcome to the bowels of society! City folk like to turn their fancy little noses up at our operation, but make no mistake, what we do here is foundational for keeping the wheels turning, or something such!

option.optiontext: Some of my belongings may have ended up amidst this junk...
And what is it exactly that you do here?

node.text: Why, we break down the things people discard into their essential components, and repurpose them with a new life! See over there, that big steam hammer-thing? It'll chew through unwanted objects and give you back something worthwhile in return.
Whatever scrap you get is likely wanted by one of our 'talented craftsmen' here at the site. Trade with them to see what they can achieve when given the right materials to work with!

option.optiontext: Some of my belongings may have ended up amidst this junk...
What can you tell me about your craftsmen?

node.text: Tinkering Ted can work absolute miracles from rare metals you get from trinkets, you wouldn't believe what Fancy Fiona will cobble together from scrap linen, Woody Willow will give your wood chips a new life and Iron Ike's will provide value for your scrap metals. You'll find them all around here somewhere!

option.optiontext: Some of my belongings may have ended up amidst this junk...

node.text: Alright then, let's see the scrap metal. I'll take it off your hands, work it into something real nice, yeah?
You think chipped wood is waste? Give it to me, I'll show you what can be done with it!
Alright darling, got scrap linen for me? No linen's ever really 'scrap' if you ask me, I'll give it a new life.
Unwanted shiny things? No worries, no shiny things are unwanted here. I might even give you something shiny you want, how's that sound?

Welcome, welcome! You've come at the perfect time. Were having a special sale: two coffins for the price of one! And dont forget about our extended family discount and free grooming services. What can I help you with today?

option.optiontext: Tell me more about the sale.
Id like to browse your supplies.
No thanks, just looking.

node.text: Ah, excellent choice! Our two-for-one coffin sale is perfect for those looking to prepare for the inevitable, or just want to take care of a loved one. And if youve got a big family, our extended family discount will make sure everyones covered! Plus, we throw in free grooming services to ensure your loved ones look their best on their final journey. Interested?

option.optiontext: Id like to browse your supplies.
Sounds great, but not today.

node.text: Oi, prison's off limits! Can't let just anybody walk in there!

option.optiontext: Not just anyone, see? Here to substitute for Guard Belford.

node.text: So I see... you've got the uniform alright, but I had no knowledge to expect anyone! Ah well, Belford's a good lad, ain't beyond him to send someone trustworthy to cover for him... Fine, go on in, but no funny business!
Yeah, what?

option.optiontext: What's behind this door?

node.text: The dungeons, where we throw all the unsavory, badly behaving misfits of Haywind. You don't wanna find yourself on the wrong side of that door.

option.optiontext: I'm here to see prisoner.
I see.

node.text: No you're not. We don't let just anyone go down there, not without a purpose! The only way I'm letting someone down there is if they're a guard, or the Marshal's specificly instructed me to escort someone. Neither seems to be the case for you, so move on!
